access: Guests will access the 3rd floor guest suite through the common area stairs and hallways of the house. Guests will not have access to the kitchen and other private areas of house.
description:
The Ford Guest Suite is a spacious third-floor apartment with natural light, high ceilings and wood floors. The suite includes a large master bedroom, a smaller bedroom with a large closet, charming bathroom, a dining area with a mini-fridge and microwave, and an alcove with a decorative, non-functioning fireplace.

Guests have access to the entire suite and the main floor to the property. The Suite is located on the third floor and a private space.

There is a friendly dog, a Labradoodle, that lives on the property.

Guests will access the 3rd floor guest suite through the common area stairs and hallways of the house. Guests will not have access to the kitchen and other private areas of house.

East Garfield Park is located on Chicago’s west side, roughly 15 minutes away from downtown. Just south of the Carol Street Corridor, east of the Garfield Park Conservatory and Golden Dome, west of Interstate 290 (7 minute-drive and 20 minutes by public transportation). Surrounding main streets are Kedzie, Sacramento (Humboldt Blvd), Lake Street, Homan (Kimball), Washington, and Madison.

The Ford Guest Suite is centrally located in East Garfield Park, about 5 miles from downtown. The CTA Green Line elevated train station is located a block and a half from the house. The Green Line will get you downtown in about 15 minutes. The CTA Kimball bus line, which travels north and south, is located half a block away. 
There are several public transportation possibilities, including Uber and Lyft. 
Madison St. Bus Route 
Homan/ Kimball St. Bus Route
Kedzie Green Line Stop

There is a friendly dog that lives on the property. However, the dog does not have access to the guest suite space. You do have your own key to the space. Also, the only people allowed on the property are guests that are on the reservation. Otherwise, there is a $100 fee if this rule is broken or at the very least communicate with someone about the situation if a guest is coming over.

access: Guests have access to entire basement. Xfinity wifi is available and we can provide you with Hulu and Netflix password if you don't have your own . Kitchen can be used when needed, we just ask that you clean up and return things to where they belong.
description:
Very convenient location, close driving to downtown and central to a lot of shopping and great restaurants! Extremely close to Loyola Hospital and Brookfield Zoo.

You have your own private living room, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, bar area, full bathroom, and laundry room in the basement. Has an apartment feel to it with plenty of privacy. Access to the kitchen, let us know and we will give you the tour of where we store cooking supplies and utilities.

Guests have access to entire basement. Xfinity wifi is available and we can provide you with Hulu and Netflix password if you don't have your own . Kitchen can be used when needed, we just ask that you clean up and return things to where they belong.

My husband and I are both mostly home  with our two small dogs. We are always available by phone call or text to help or give suggestions. Just ask!

Ranch style house, very close to 290 expressway and 20 minute drive to downtown. You have your very own parking spot in the driveway! 2 minute drive to strip mall including, but not limited to Aldi, Super Target, walgreens, LA Fitness, and Marshalls. A bunch of places to grab a bite to eat, including our personal favorite Sliccily. It's a fantastic pizzeria/bar. 15 minutes from Oak Brook Center Mall and 6 minute drive from North Riverside Mall and a handful of great restaurants. Quiet and pet friendly neighborhood. Bus stops are all along 1st Ave. We are in a very convenient location!

Plenty of bus stops that are walking distance. 7 minute drive to forest park blue line cta station.

Must be comfortable with dogs. Ours might bark a bit when you’re coming and going, but are completely harmless. One chihuahua and one puppy coton de tulear.

We use laundry room downstairs. You will be responsible to keep your private room clean and organized. Clean bed sheets and towels are available in your close.  Dishes or any kitchen utensils must be clean after you used them. Garbage will be disposable once every Thursday, but you can empty the garbage container, if you need it.

City of Chicago requires the following: 
-Name, address, and signature of all guests
-Host is not allowed to serve food or drink without a separate license, I do not have a license. 
-Quiet Hours 8am-8pm
This is not unique to my home, this is required for all homes in the City of Chicago, see: https://assets.airbnb.com/legal/chicago_ordinance_2017.pdf?_ga=2.28225276.1528044236.1509554231-670944706.1502465110

access:
Everything inside of home and the designated balcony and roof, not other roofs,  not other parking spaces or alley (you will get towed). Parks are open as well.

City of Chicago requires a registry to be made for both guests and hosts, it must be completed prior to access to avoid fines and penalties from the City of Chicago
description:
In walking distance to shops, restaurants, movie theater, theaters, museums, libraries, Little Italy, Greektown, West Loop, McCormick Place, Grant Park, Millennium Park, Solider Field, the Lake&more.

City living but with large, lush spaces in and outside the home, private rooftop deck, 1 indoor space connected to the home, 1 outdoor parking space, steps away from playground & parks. 

Best location in Chicago!

For security, cameras at all entry doors (garage, roof, kitchen balcony&front).

4-story space with 2 parking spaces (one indoor and one outdoor space) lives like a single family home, the roof top deck has the best views in Chicago, and the walkability of this space is second to none.

City of Chicago requires a registry to be made for both guests and hosts, it must be completed prior to access to avoid fines and penalties from the City of Chicago

Everything inside of home and the designated balcony and roof, not other roofs,  not other parking spaces or alley (you will get towed). Parks are open as well.

City of Chicago requires a registry to be made for both guests and hosts, it must be completed prior to access to avoid fines and penalties from the City of Chicago

Feel free to message us with any questions, we are available at a minimum from 7am to 9pm.

The house is in a neighborhood that boasts the best of both worlds—lots of green space, but near all the important places in Chicago. It’s within walking distance of restaurants, museums, Little Italy, West Loop, Millennium Park, and much more.

Uber, taxi, el, walk

Area hotels with studio and parking space are $350 a night. This home is heavily discounted, full home with 3 sleeping areas  & 2 parking spaces, nightly rate should be about $2000.

Due to abuses with guest count, cameras are at all
Entry points.  If there are abuses, reservation will be changed for guest count, additional guests not on original reservation will be charged $99 per night regardless of number and increase on my guest list and the security deposit will be forfeited.

Daily housekeeping can be arranged rates start at 125 to 250 depending on clean up.
house_rules:
City of Chicago requires the following: 
-Name, address, and signature of all guests
-Host is not allowed to serve food or drink without a separate license, I do not have a license. 
-Quiet Hours 8am-8pm
This is not unique to my home, this is required for all homes in the City of Chicago, see: https://assets.airbnb.com/legal/chicago_ordinance_2017.pdf?_ga=2.28225276.1528044236.1509554231-670944706.1502465110

access: You will have access to the entire space - 4 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen, back deck, and back yard.
description: Wind down in the elegant living room in front of the statement fireplace after a day of adventures. This peaceful, north-side retreat is on the top floor of a 120-year-old greystone, where comfort and style combine with sophistication and elegance.
house_rules:
- Check in is at 3pm and checkout is at 10am. Late checkout until 1130am (sometimes later with notice) is $50 extra. 
- Quiet hours from 10pm to 8am. 
- Please no shoes worn inside the house and avoid leaving drinks on wood tables.
- Please sleep under sheets and remove decorative pillows and throw blankets.  
- Be tidy and leave our home as you found it.
interaction: Send me a text or call.
neighborhood_overview: This home is in the heart of it all, just a 10-minute drive to the lake, beach, and Wrigley Field. A strip mall is close by with different food outlets. Uptown's Green Mill Jazz club, Riviera Theatre, and Aragon Ballroom are a short bus ride away.
notes: Deluxe California King Blowup Mattress available for living room. Very comfortable.
space: Down comforters, nice towels and linens + stylish design and comfort
summary: Wind down in the elegant living room in front of the statement fireplace after a day of adventures. This peaceful, north-side retreat is on the top floor of a 120-year-old greystone, where comfort and style combine with sophistication and elegance.
transit:
The Montrose Brown Line stop is a 7 minute walk directly west.
The #22 bus is a 2 minute walk away and takes you to Wrigleyville (south 10 mins) and Andersonville (North 10 mins)
The #78 bus stops right outside and can take you Montrose Beach (east 10 mins) or to the Blue Line airport transfer (west about 25 minutes)
Free Street parking on Montrose or Ashland is usually available.

access:
Guests have access to their own private room and to the common areas of the basement. 
A total of 3 rooms are available in the basement so you will be sharing the common spaces with the other 2 rooms. If you a larger group you can rent out all rooms together, please check out my other listings.
Guests have 24-hour access to the basement and the private bedroom via keypad door locks
description:
This nice room has been furnished to a great standard. It’s the ideal retreat for a comfortable & cozy stay, located to the south of Chicago. We believe it’s the ultimate location to find some seclusion while needing to be close to downtown Chicago. Get ready to get inspired! Very close to a pristine stretch of lakefront. All in all, guaranteed enjoyment and relaxation. All day long.

This simply styled room makes for a perfectly convenient getaway. Ideal for couples who need to be in the area. But an especially great space for solo and business travelers. Great for people looking for a laid back place to stay. Perfect if you want to be close to the hustle and bustle of Chicago but not right in the middle of it. If you need it, it’s a 20minute drive to downtown. Comfortable, calm and convenient. We love to go that extra mile, so you feel like you are at home.

Without a doubt, this place makes for a true “revival” for those in need of one. We are sure you will enjoy this room as much as we do.

We’ll supply you with:
- Ultra comfortable bed Linen
- Towels
- Bathrobes
- Toiletries
- Fast & Free Wi-Fi
- Fully stocked fridge

We guarantee a private stay. The bathroom is shared with three other rooms. Upon your arrival, we will stock up the fridge with fresh milk, yogurts, cereals, drinks and some other healthy and extremely tasteful essentials. To make sure you have the basics without having to leave home to get them.

We have provided teas, coffee, and snacks, so all that’s left for you to do is relax and settle in after your journey. Or if you prefer, you can enjoy a refreshing shower; we have stocked the bathroom with gentle toiletries.

Guests have access to their own private room and to the common areas of the basement. 
A total of 3 rooms are available in the basement so you will be sharing the common spaces with the other 2 rooms. If you a larger group you can rent out all rooms together, please check out my other listings.
Guests have 24-hour access to the basement and the private bedroom via keypad door locks

We will be happy to tailor to all of your needs during your stay to make your trip to Chicago an unforgettable one. After you check in via SMART lock, we can answer any questions you have, provide local advice and directions as required. Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to local recommendations. We will be happy to assist you with any needs you may have during your visit. Besides that, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.

The home is located on a very quiet block less than nine miles from downtown Chicago and two to three miles from the University of Chicago campus and the Museum of Science and Industry. It is also located within blocks of the future site for the Obama Presidential Library.
Hyde park, many biking trails, lakefront, restaurants, supermarkets, Starbucks, Jackson Park Hospital and much more are just a stone throw away.

The property is close walking distance from CTA public bus lines and Metra Train which heads straight to the downtown area and south suburban areas.

Room amenities
- Fully furnished & nicely designed
- fridge - SMART TV – Hulu, Netflix - Chromecast
Extra facilities
- Bluetooth speaker
- Extremely comfortable double bed
- Great bed linen
Shared bathroom
- Toiletries
- Towels
- Hair-Dryer
A wonderful kind of seclusion. This means you can enjoy a truly quiet and homely atmosphere. All in all, a quiet and convenient retreat.
Contact us today for a unique BnB experience! We would love to welcome you to your home away from home. For any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact us.

additional_house_rules:
All bookings require a security deposit of $250 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in. 

Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. 

Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 

Our locations do not allow pets. 

No parties, gatherings or events of any kind are allowed in the unit. 

If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $25 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 

Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 

Lost or unreturned keys at the time of checkout will be charged a $50 per set.

If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full. 

If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately. 

If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance. 

When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.

Shoes off, please.

description:
Treat yourself to a modern getaway in a Stratus Suite at North Cleaver Street! Enjoy the comforts and privacy of a light, airy apartment near the chicest galleries and gourmet cuisine.

Designed with the traveler in mind, this 2 Bedroom Stratus Suite (sleeps 8) caters to all your needs in a spacious layout with cool, natural decor that gives the Windsor Suite a playful feel in a vibrant city. 

Stratus suites offer guests the comfort and style of a hotel without all the fuss. Complete with fresh furnishings and smart decor, each room is suited to the trendy traveler who craves comfort in new places. At the primary status level, the Stratus suite is ready to make you feel at home.

At a Glance

* Custom furnishings 
* Full and spacious kitchen
* Large flatscreen Smart TV
* Fast Internet 
*On the Art Walk
*Concierge services available from 9am to 10pm (central)

Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.
Concierge services available from 9am to 10pm (central)

description:
Have you ever seen a vacation rental that had HALF the love put into it as this one? Make sure you book your stay quick because this place won't last on the market long. The Wirgleyville Design Retreat is fully stocked and tastefully designed to be your retreat from the hustle and bustle of Clark Street. Go out, cheer on the cubs, enjoy the bars in Wrigleyville or even dance the night away in Boystown. Conveniently located in the heart of the action, you won't want to miss this vacation!

From the ivy wall to the hand written chalk local suggestions to your own little slice of balcony heaven, what more could you ask for from a space? The Wrigleyville Design Retreat spared no expense in making sure their guests will have a fantastic and luxurious time on stay.

Guests will receive access to the unit upon booking.

This vacation rental is managed by Hoasty.co. Hoasty manages rentals across the USA completely remotely, that means we are only a text away if you need anything, have any questions or even want some advice to have a fabulous vacation.

Conveniently located in the heart of Wrigleyville, you are close to both the Red Line and the Purple line. Whether you want to zip down to the heart of one of the largest cities in the United States, or you want to go north and see the beautiful sights of the suburbs... all is less than 30 minutes by train!

description:
Beautiful, newly remodeled 3 bedroom 2.5 bath Victorian home with high-end finishes, lots of natural light, great location! Safe and gorgeous neighborhood with great restaurants and bars, walkable to Wrigley Field, 2 blocks from the Brown-line train stop to downtown. Hosts are happy to recommend things to do in Chicago and best way to get around!

Next to the brown-line train to downtown, easy to get anywhere in the city! (The train does make some noise but minimal with windows shut)

We are available by phone/text as well as messaging through app. We live in the apartment below so we are available most of the time if you need anything!

Blocks from Starbucks, Trader Joe’s, comedy club/theatres, bars, restaurants, walkable to Wrigleyville

We have free garage parking and an extra parking pad! The brown-line train is the easiest, fastest, and cheapest way to downtown only 2 blocks away!

additional_house_rules:
no check in past 10pm (curfew) 
We completely renovated the nearly 100 year old building in 2014. All new plumbing, water service, mechanicals, floors, new bath rooms with huge walk in shower and fully appointed kitchen with new appliances, Kuerig coffee maker (a wide selection of k coup coffee and tea bags), toaster (we provide the bread and muffins)  etc. So everything works.  
Regarding our old building: You will hear the tenants downstairs moving around and they will hear you if you have the TV or music turned up or if you have loud voices or stomp around. Please moderate your sound, including your footsteps, so that we minimize disturbing the neighbors, especially after 10pm.

We welcome families with children, however we do not rent to individuals or groups under the age of 21.
 
No drugs, no smoking.  If you smoke, there is a $500 cleaning fee. If you do drugs? We will ask you to leave. 

Pets may be allowed if we discuss it beforehand.
 If you bring a pet, we require a $250 security deposit for the pet, in addition to the regular deposit.

If anything isn’t working, please contact Jeffrey immediately. Text message is probably best. Reach out if you need anything for the apartment or you just want  advice on where to go and what to do.

Checking in and out
We will provide instructions in advance of your stay. If you need to make special arrangements please contact Jeffrey.
We ask that you not use the rear access except to empty waste cans if that is necessary.

Equipment
There is a manual inside the "book" box on the coffee table with instructions for the printer/scanner, TV, DVD, coffee maker, dishwasher, washer and dryer and HVAC.

No candles.
Use the coasters, trivets and placemats to protect the furniture.
If you have a small child  who is still in diapers traveling with you, please take any soiled ones to the garbage cans in the backyard next to the alley ASAP (before you leave for the day). Do not leave them in the trash.

No parties. No drugs. Clean up after yourself. Basic grown up behavior.
House cleaning is every Monday at 8am. Guest must leave the premises for at least 2 hours. . 
No food of any kind is to be stored in your room. 
No guests are allowed to stay in your room over night. 
All guests must check in with the host. 

Basically, we just ask that you treat the apartment well, and have a great stay. And we hope that you will want to come back again.

description:
I have a 4BR apartment. When my kids aren't here I rent out the entire place, or single rooms a la carte. This is my daughters room.
Halfway between O'Hare and the Loop, private bedroom/bathroom in a sunny third floor walkup apartment, with HUGE walk-in shower, access to fully appointed kitchen, day bed, Washer/dryer, Wi-Fi internet, premier cable TV/Netflix, all amenities. Blue Line or street parking. Please check map before booking.

It's cozy and affordable and only available if my daughter is not using it. 
A single bed (best mattress in the building!) is all yours in this spacious 3rd floor walk up (no elevator) in a huge, sunny 4 bedroom apartment with 1.5 bath. Totally gut-rehabbed in 2014.  You will have the middle  bedroom. You are welcome to use the fully equipped kitchen; just clean up after yourself. You will enjoy super fast Wi-Fi internet, premium cable TV/Netflix/Amazon and a 50 inch smart TV. Please check the map before you book. This is great access to freeway and close to O'Hare and short drive to hot spots downtown, even closer to Bucktown, Wicker Park, really close to Logan Square but NOT walking distance to much.

I am totally available via text any time day or night. 312-961-4742
Do not hesitate to contact me any time for any reason of you need anything or have a concern of any kind.

Really easy actually. It's about a 10  minute walk, with luggage,  to the Blue Line which goes to the Loop in 25 min or outbound to O'Hare in about 20.  We can provide detailed instructions on how to get here from either airport using the L.
You can park on the street if you are traveling by car. If you prefer to use taxis  from the airport you can do that in their taxi line. Once you are here, taxis and  Uber cars are available to pick you up within a few minutes.

Most likely you will want to use the Blue Line to go into and out of the city,
You can stop at any of the great urban neighborhoods on the way in (Irving Park, Logan Square,  Bucktown/Wicker Park at the North & Damen stop, for example). You can take the Blue Line straight in to Clark and Lake to transfer to Orange, Brown, Purple, Pink and Greeen lines, or on to the Jackson stop and walk three blocks over to Michigan Avenue and you will be at the Chicago Architecture Foundation about a block from the Art Institute.

Buses and other options:
The Montrose bus is two blocks away and a 25 min ride to the beachfront at Lake Michigan, less than that to the Brown Line. 
The Lawrence Ave bus is a few blocks north and travels east about a mile to the Brown Line (or all the way to the lakefront, too). Brown Line goes to the Loop and stops a couple of blocks from Michigan Avenue as well, with stops along the way at DePaul or Lincoln Park or Old Town.
You can transfer to the Red Line from the Brown Line at Belmont or Fullerton and go to the Apple Store Lincoln Park or keep going  and get off at Grand to walk over to North Michigan Avenue and the Magnificent Mile or on into the Loop to State Street or Michigan Avenue for the Art Institute, Millennium Park, and beyond. Lots of transportation options.

If you are traveling north (west) by car, take the Montrose exit from the Kennedy Expressway (I 90) and go east on Montrose and turn left on our street. Traveling south (east) on I94, take the Wilson Avenue exit, go east about four blocks, turn right and go to Sunnyside, turn left on Sunnyside and continue east to where it stops, then go left a couple of houses.

We got a Labrador puppy last year. Cassius. He’s 1 year now in 2019. Super friendly. Horrible guard dog. Loves all people. Sleeps in the way back porch. Never in anyone’s room, unless you invite him. 

$250 fee if you don’t return the keys

access: Guests are welcome to use appliances including the fridge, stove, microwave, Keurig coffee maker, and BBQ grill.
description:
Walk to Wrigley, Boystown or Lake Michigan from this spacious, top floor, recently renovated condo in Buena Park. South facing windows let in lots of light. The large guest bedroom is adjacent to a covered deck. Enjoy your own private, full bathroom. Guests rave about this sparking clean condo with an excellent location. The CTA red line train is 2 blocks away and several bus lines can get you downtown or anywhere in the Windy City with ease. All Guests Welcome!

This top floor unit features high ceilings, updated kitchen and bathrooms, and is situated on a beautiful tree-lined street in the historic Buena Park neighborhood.

Guests are welcome to use appliances including the fridge, stove, microwave, Keurig coffee maker, and BBQ grill.

The guest bedroom is at the end of the hallway away from the living room and the master bedroom so there is plenty of privacy for guests.

Buena Park is a neighborhood within Chicago's Uptown community bordered by one of the most historical sites in Chicago, the Graceland Cemetery and Arboretum, founded in 1860 and on the National Register of Historic Places. Lake Michigan is on the eastern border with bike and running/walking paths. You can be on Montrose beach in minutes. The popular Lakeview and Wrigleyville neighborhoods are a short walk south and Uptown/Andersonville are just to the north.

My condo is literally steps away from several public transportation options.  The Sheridan red line stop is two blocks away, the #36 Broadway bus is at the end of the street and the #151 bus is at the other end. Express buses to Michigan Avenue and the Loop are also a short walk away. There are two Divvy bike stations within 2 blocks.

Please note that the building does not have an elevator but there are only two flights of stairs to reach the third floor which is the top floor.

- Checkout time: Noon

access: You are able to use the kitchen and living room. Laundry room  is located through the back door and stairs on the first floor near the garage.
description:
This apartment is most comfortable for students . If you're looking for a home base for a stay in Chicago it will be great for you. It's not in a walkable or touristy neighborhood, but it's very close to downtown and there is a bus right outside my door that runs right into the west loop and downtown. There is a large grocery store on my intersection so your necessities can be taken care of easily.  Close to hospitals for medical students and rotations.

This is a 3 bedroom and 2 bathroom apartment. All rooms are subject to Airbnb. 2 bedrooms are standard Chicago size with closets, and they share a  bathroom that is located near the kitchen. The middle room is a master bedroom, and it has its own bathroom inside.  All guests are welcome to use the kitchen and living room mindfully. Be mindful of your own cleaningness in the common areas as this is something I am unable to control on an hourly basis or daily basis. You will have to do your own dishes as the condo does not have a dishwasher. This listing is for a front bedroom with a shared bathroom.

You are able to use the kitchen and living room. Laundry room  is located through the back door and stairs on the first floor near the garage.

I am available to help most of the time and I tend to respond quickly if I am not in a mid flight.

The Near West Side , one of the 77 community areas of Chicago, is on the West Side, west of the Chicago River and adjacent to the Loop and West Loop. The history of the Near West Side of Chicago includes the founding of Hull House, a prominent settlement house. The Great Chicago Fire started in the Near West Side. The area is home to the University of Illinois at Chicago (UIC), the United Center and the Illinois Medical (URL HIDDEN) not a very walkable neighborhood, but bigger streets such as Madison and Western are more interesting to walk through.

My listings are very close to public transportation. The bus stop is right on the intersection and my house is 5th from a major intersection with 2 buses.  The way chicago works is that each bus goes in a straight line. Madison bus goes to downtown, loop, Sears (Willis) tower and Millennium Park, and Western bus goes to different neighborhoods such as Bucktown and Wicker Park.  Blue line is about 8 minute walk, and also goes to downtown, loop and the airport.  Also if you get Uber and use UberPool, its only about $2.50-3$ to get around which is not that much different from public transportation prices ($2-$2.25).

Please keep it clean in the common areas.  Personal belongings should be kept in your room and not left on common sofas, dining tables etc.

access: Guests will have the entire main floor apartment to themselves, this apartment is solely used for vacation rentals and is not a lived in residence unlike other local listings.
description:
Newly renovated main floor 2 bedroom 1 bath apartment located in hip and trendy Logan Square neighborhood, only  a few short miles from downtown. Bright and open space. 

Plenty of well reviewed bars and restaurants within a short walk.  Located just off Kedzie Blvd on quiet tree lined street.

A few short steps from the popular 606 park as well as Palmer Square park. Super close access to Divvy bikes for a ride on the 606 too.

Typically ample amount on non-permitted street parking available.

We JUST Did a very thorough renovation of the property and are excited to share it with you! Modern and classic elements  as well as hand made decor items through out makes this 124 year old property an amazing place to stay!

Guests will have the entire main floor apartment to themselves, this apartment is solely used for vacation rentals and is not a lived in residence unlike other local listings.

We will be more than happy to help you find your way around the neighborhood and offer suggestions of our favorite places and activities, just ask! If not, we will leave you to enjoy and explore on your own.

Cheap eats and bike-friendly streets. Gourmet coffee, scruffy dive bars and artisanal cocktail lounges. Some may say it's a recipe for a hipster haven but there's a proud, working-class sensibility that keeps this Northwest Side neighborhood grounded. In Logan Square, the strong neighborly connection is evident all around, from active preservation groups to community gardens and a locally-run farmers market. "Local" being the key word when describing many aspects of the scene: ingredients are sourced locally at their buzz-worthy restaurants; corner taps tout local, craft brews; galleries showcase local artists; and concerts and street fests promote local, upstart bands.
At the heart of this community is the actual "square" in Logan Square. It comes together at the intersection of Kedzie and Logan Boulevard, where a circle interchange meets with Milwaukee Avenue. The boulevards themselves are widened thoroughfares that are set apart by grassy, landscaped medians and tall, stately trees that border both its sides. The neighborhood boasts four of them in total and these link together to form Chicago's "Emerald Necklace," an expansive system of interconnected parks and streetscapes dotted with beautifully-restored mansions, handsome greystone homes and majestic churches.

There are several CTA bus lines close by, as well a few blue line train stops within a 15 minute walk. I would also suggest Divvy bikes (especially a ride on the 606), and for longer trips, Uber is the fastest in the area.

No additional guests allowed on property unless cleared in advance with owner. 


No open flames (candles, Incense etc…)

summary:
Newly renovated main floor 2 bedroom 1 bath apartment located in hip and trendy Logan Square neighborhood, only  a few short miles from downtown. Bright and open space. 

Plenty of well reviewed bars and restaurants within a short walk.  Located just off Kedzie Blvd on quiet tree lined street.

A few short steps from the popular 606 park as well as Palmer Square park. Super close access to Divvy bikes for a ride on the 606 too.

Typically ample amount on non-permitted street parking available.
transit: There are several CTA bus lines close by, as well a few blue line train stops within a 15 minute walk. I would also suggest Divvy bikes (especially a ride on the 606), and for longer trips, Uber is the fastest in the area.

access: Yard with seating and grill.
description:
In the heart of Chicago! Walk to wrigley field, the lake, restaurants, bars, and public transport. Also near the elevated train that in minutes takes you to the central business district, Michigan Mile, Navy Pier area, etc. 
This is one of few original historic homes that survived the 1871 Great Chicago Fire with lots of history. 
Divvy bicycles are right next to the home as well--for $3 you can rent a bike to explore the neighborhood. 
*Rate is discounted in exchange for reviews.*

Entire private 2bed flat!

Yard with seating and grill.

Available for questions else not around.

Restaurants, the lake, local coffee shops right across the road , Public transport connected to all other parts of Chicago.

Public transport is steps away connected to all parts of Chicago. 
Divvy bikes are around the corner. 
Uber and Lyft are very cheap. Everything you need is walking distance though.

Any additional guests beyond  the number you book, have to be announced prior to stay. The fee is per house guest regardless of whether they sleep there or only attend an event.


If you are planning the stay with your pet, please do let us know in advance.
Additional cleaning fee after your pet is $35.

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund.

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to the designated location by the agreed upon check-out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out penalty.
3.) Absolutely no smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises. Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any entrance.
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily.
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
6.) No parties, excessive noise, or illegal activity, and guests must
comply with all state and local laws and ordinances.

description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

My 2 bedroom apartment is steps to some of the best nightlife in the city.  Division street boasts wide sidewalks with many restaurant patios.  The Division Blue Line "L" is 2 blocks away making it super easy to get about the city or in from the airport.  Enjoy a sunny family room, 1.5 baths, in unit washer and dryer and a covered back deck.

One of Chicago's creative epicenters lies just outside downtown Chicago in Wicker Park and Bucktown. These synonymous neighborhoods are famous for live music and nightlife, chef-driven restaurants and countless art galleries — many housed within the Flat Iron Arts Building. If you have an acute knowledge of craft cocktails or an affinity for coffee, plus want to sift through records or thrifted threads, there's no better area to sip and shop in the country.

The area has become a prevailing influence on Chicago's Michelin-rated, James Beard Award-winning dining scene, boasting some of the city's most sought after tables. Wicker Park and Bucktown are also known for their palate pleasing nightcaps, like renowned brewery Piece and mixology tour de force The Violet Hour.

Along North, Division, Milwaukee and Damen Avenues, you will find an unbelievable blend of vintage shops amid independently-owned boutiques touting fashions for both men and women, and luxury home goods and beauty products. On the same blocks are nationally-recognized names in fashion, and a mix of major retail chains that have also set up shop to satisfy the on-trend crowds.

access:
Private bedroom. Shared kitchen, bathroom, living room, and dining area. We carefully select our guests for hosting, 98% of our guests are graduate students and young professionals who are in town for conferences.Parking is free and is street parking in front of the apartment.
Check in is any time after 5 pm, early check in is possible
Checkout is before 12 noon, late check-out is possible
description:
Affordable private bedroom in the south loop of Chicago. We have hosted over 3000 different users on our Airbnb apartments. Free WiFi, Free Netflix, and free street parking. We are close to restaurants, bars, museums, and Universities.

Complimentary bottled water, fresh fruits, can soda, and wine

A private bedroom within a centrally located large 3 bedroom apartment with beds, refrigerator, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, etc. Living room has a couch and TV with Netflix, local channels, sports channels (ESPN, NBC). We carefully select our guests for hosting, 98% of our guests are graduate students and young professionals who are in town for conferences.

The apartment is very close to downtown and great view of city from the top rear deck of the building. Affordable, clean, friendly, close proximity (1-5 min) to transportation such as buses and trains. Close to bars, restaurants, stadiums, points of interest such as Grant Park, Millennium Park, and McCormick Place. Night life and food is great!!!

The price is the cheapest you can find in Chicago. This is because we enjoy hosting travelers and meeting exciting people from all over the world, being that we are international people ourselves this is extremely fun for us.

Free and available street parking and Free WiFi. Towels, bedding, shampoo, and body wash is provided.

Several small/medium art museums in the neighborhood and the University Village and University of Illinois is a stone throw away.

Great view of the the city's skyline from rear deck

Access to roof, back porch, back yard, and a park with pool is 1 min away.

Great and affordable food in the neighborhood

Close to lake Michigan

Number 8 bus (to Broadway-5 minute walk away), number 18 bus (to Michigan Avenue-1 minute walk away), and the pink line train are a few blocks away. The Chicago Transit Authority (i.e CTA) bus routes 9, 21 and 60 are also 5 minutes away.

Check in is any time after 5 pm, early check in is possible
Checkout is before 12 noon, late check-out is possible

We are busy but surely finds time for our guests.

Number 8 bus (to Broadway-5 minute walk away), number 18 bus (to Michigan Avenue-1 minute walk away), and the pink line train are a few blocks away. The Chicago Transit Authority (i.e CTA) bus routes 9, 21 and 60 are also 5 minutes away.

Free WiFi, Free Netflix, and Free parking. We don't charge a security deposit

The address is 1115 W 19th PLACE and not 1115 W 19th STREET. 19th STREET is one block from 19th PLACE.

Number 8 bus (to Broadway-5 minute walk away), number 18 bus (to Michigan Avenue-1 minute walk away), and the pink line train are a few blocks away. The Chicago Transit Authority (i.e CTA) bus routes 9, 21 and 60 are also 5 minutes away.
summary:
Affordable private bedroom in the south loop of Chicago. We have hosted over 3000 different users on our Airbnb apartments. Free WiFi, Free Netflix, and free street parking. We are close to restaurants, bars, museums, and Universities.

Complimentary bottled water, fresh fruits, can soda, and wine

additional_house_rules:
All bookings require a security deposit of $500 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in. 

Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. 

Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 

Our locations do not allow pets. 

No parties, gatherings or events of any kind are allowed in the unit. 

If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $50 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 

Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 

Lost or unreturned keys will result in an additional $100 fee (per set).

If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full. 

If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately. 

If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance. 

When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.

Shoes off, please.

description:
Watch a movie in style on the 55-inch 4K TV and sound bar within this sophisticated apartment. The modern, spacious layout with metropolitan decor includes every comfort, from the Nespresso coffee maker to the complimentary designer bath products.

Designed with the traveler in mind, this 2 Bedroom Alto Suite (sleeps 6) caters to all your needs in a modern, spacious layout with artistic decor that gives this suite a sophisticated edge.

Don’t hesitate to contact us if you need anything, from extra towels to restaurant recommendations. Otherwise, we’ll leave you to enjoy your stay.

This apartment is located within walking distance of McCormick Place Convention Center. It's also only a short drive to all tourist attractions, including the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and Chicago Bean.

description:
Close to downtown Chicago, IIT, McCorMick Place Convention Center. Private  bedroom. Shared bathroom with just one other person. Renovated historic Victorian rowhouse with charming original architectural structures.  High ceiling. Exposed brick walll. Hardwood floor.

On 2nd floor. Full bed, small desk, small closet. Big window.

FREE use of washer/Dryer. FREE WIFI. 15 minutes drive to downtown. 15 minutes on Redline or Greenline train (only 3 stops to reach downtown). Also many buses to downtown. Central air conditioning at nights and weekends in the Summer. 24 hrs (thermostat) central heat in the Winter.

Duplex home with kitchen and living room on the 1st floor. Back yard with wood deck equipped with bbq. You will have a private bedroom on 2nd floor. Shared bathroom on 1st floor with just one another person.

* 3 blocks to Green Line and Red Line. Half a block to bus #4 from downtown. A few blocks to bus #3 to Water Tower, and #29 to Navy Pier.

* 15 blocks to McCormick Place convention center. Taxi should cost less than $10. Or take bus #3. Or nice long walk in Summer.

* 3-block walk to Illinois Institute of Technology (IIT), 35th street campus.

* 6 blocks to Vandercook college of music

* 7 blocks to IL college of Optometry 

* 13 blocks (biking distance) from Mercy Hospital 

Plenty of free street parking at the front of the house. Also gated parking pad in backyard. Friendly homeowner. 

We provide a safe and secure homestay -- once confirm your booking, you will need to confirm your identity by emailing me a copy of passport, or student ID, or intern letter or evidence of employment. 

Full access to kitchen, living room, and back deck. However, light cooking only, please - no splashy oily or smoky cooking.

PLEASE NOTE: Up-and-coming neighborhood. Police head-quarters is just a block away. We, all at the house, use public transportation -- "VERY" convenient.

This bedroom is at the top of staircases on 2nd floor. Washer/dryer is next to this room. We ask guests to use washer/dryer only during daytime. So if you are a very light sleeper or have an odd shift who needs to sleep at day time, this might not work well.

description:
This modern garden unit newly renovated apartment is ideal accommodation for groups as it can host up to 9 guests in it's 4 bedrooms. Simple and neat, it offers all the modern amenities that will make your stay comfortable and pleasant. You will love the neighborhood for the vast amount of music, art, culinary tradition, and nightlife options.

It's not by chance that Pilsen was named one of the “12 Coolest Neighborhoods Around the World” by Forbes.

Enjoy your stay!

Feel free to call or text me through Airbnb and I will be glad to help!

additional_house_rules:
- Quiet hours inside the home are from 8:30 pm to 6 am.  Outside the home as enforced by the City of Chicago, quiet hours are from 10 pm to 8 am. 
- No shoes inside the home. 
- Prior to departure, please start towels in the washer.  Leave beds unmade if used. 
- No guests other than those on the reservation. 
- Absolutely NO SMOKING!! 
- Please respect the neighbors by keeping the volume down. 
- Absolutely no loitering around the home.  The neighborhood is strict regarding this policy. 
- No deliveries to our home.  We will not be held responsible for lost/stolen packages. 
- Check in is anytime after 3 pm. Checkout is by 11 am sharp.  Unfortunately, we can no longer offer early check in due to the timing needed for cleaning in between patrons.

access: Guests will be able to access lower level of the home only. You may hear the sound of the alarm chime when entering and exiting the unit, as the system is currently connected to the remainder of the home.
description:
Newly renovated guest suite in historic Bronzeville, one of Chicago's most vibrant neighborhoods.  Blocks from three train lines, US cellular field (aka White Sox Stadium), Illinois Institute of Technology, McCormick Place, and Chicago's beautiful lake front.

This home was built in 1882 and is an official Chicago Historic Landmark!  The barn style doors that separate the unit from the rest of the house were salvaged from the master suite along with other fixtures.  In the early 1900s, the owner, a native from Mississippi (during the great migration to Chicago) came to the city and immediately began working hard to become apart of Chicago's bustling economy.  He purchased this property along with the home next door that is currently being renovated. The Chicago Landmark Association deemed both properties as Historic Chicago Landmarks which means that these properties are apart of Chicago's architectural history and must be preserved for years to come.  As new Bronzeville natives, we are excited to be apart of the neighborhood's revitalization.  Bronzeville has always been known as the midwestern "Harlem Renaissance" and we are eager to see the continued development in the area.  We are lucky to have salvaged a piece of the city's dynamic history with our home. Please enjoy your stay and take some time to indulge in any curiosity you may have about the history and future plans of this lovely Chicago Neighborhood.  

#Bronzeville
#HistoricDouglass
#TheGap

Guests will be able to access lower level of the home only. You may hear the sound of the alarm chime when entering and exiting the unit, as the system is currently connected to the remainder of the home.

Historic Bronzeville, also known as the "Black Metropolis", is a narrow strip that is home to historic landmark homes, as well as some of the most celebrated works within the City of Chicago's Public Art Collection. Of note is a sculpture-adorned stretch of Martin Luther King Drive that features Alison Saar's "Monument to the Great Northern Migration," The Bronzeville Walk of Fame, and The Victory Monument. Pulitzer Prize recipient Gwendolyn Brooks, civil rights activist Ida B. Wells, and legendary musician Louis Armstrong were profoundly responsible for the area's development and subsequent cultural crusade, which included advances in civil rights, jazz, blues and gospel music as well.  Bronzeville has much to offer by way of boutiques, coffee shops, restaurants and night life. Welcome to Bronzeville!

The home is in walking distance to the CTA bus, CTA Green/Red line, Lake via either 31st Street or the 35th Street Pedestrian Bridge, and Lou Jones Metra Rail.  Free street parking.

We pride ourselves on hosting you in the cleanest environment possible.  We have professionals clean the unit to ensure that you have a comfortable and refreshing stay.

The unit is located in a pedestrian area, in the City of Chicago.  You may hear sounds of the city (people talking/yelling, music as cars pass by, etc), or sounds of fireworks from White Sox Stadium, which is located within walking distance of the unit via 35th street, going westbound. During 4th of July week there will be sounds of fireworks into the evenings.

The most walkable routes are usually north toward IIT and downtown.  You literally can walk to the south loop area from our home!  35th street is safe but it as very bustling and transient street.  If you are looking for a more quiet time, you can get around and avoid the traffic.  Parking is accessible!
house_rules:
- Quiet hours inside the home are from 8:30 pm to 6 am.  Outside the home as enforced by the City of Chicago, quiet hours are from 10 pm to 8 am. 
- No shoes inside the home. 
- Prior to departure, please start towels in the washer.  Leave beds unmade if used. 
- No guests other than those on the reservation. 
- Absolutely NO SMOKING!! 
- Please respect the neighbors by keeping the volume down. 
- Absolutely no loitering around the home.  The neighborhood is strict regarding this policy. 
- No deliveries to our home.  We will not be held responsible for lost/stolen packages. 
- Check in is anytime after 3 pm. Checkout is by 11 am sharp.  Unfortunately, we can no longer offer early check in due to the timing needed for cleaning in between patrons.

additional_house_rules:
All bookings require a security deposit of $250 or more. This deposit will not be charged in advance.

Kindly note that the special reduction in Cleaning Fees is only for the Winter Season hence the regular Cleaning fees of USD 125 will be applicable for all arrivals on or after 01 March, 2019 on wards.

For security purposes, we require all guests to provide an ID verification, license, or passport before check-in. 

Guests can cancel within 24 hours of booking and receive a full refund, or cancel anytime up to seven days before the start of your trip and receive a 50% refund. Trips cancelled fewer than seven days in advance are not eligible for refunds. 

Check-in time is any time after 4 P.M. Check-out time is any time before 11 a.m. If an earlier check-in or a later check-out time is desired, then you can send us a request. However, this is not guaranteed. We do not allow smoking; breaking this rule will incur a $300 fine. 

Our locations do not allow pets. 

No parties, gatherings or events of any kind are allowed in the unit. 

If a location is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $25 for every extra hour of cleaning required. 

Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises or its facilities. By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises. Guests recognize that they may personally purchase insurance to protect themselves in such events. 

Lost or unreturned keys at the time of checkout will be charged a $50 per set.

If more guests sleep at a location than the number originally stated in the booking, the security deposit will be charged in full. 

We may ask to hold in advance a damage/security deposit for last minute reservations or local stays.

If you notice anything that presents a danger that could result in damage to the location or to any individuals, let us know immediately. 

If guests delay the cleaners from beginning their cleaning at the predetermined check-out time, guests will be charged $50. This fee is applied to any late checkout between 11 am and 1 pm. Any guest who is still in the location after 1 pm will be charged for an extra night. This does not apply if our team has approved a late checkout in advance. 

When you make a reservation with us, you are agreeing to all of the above House Rules.

Shoes off, please.

access: The entire apartment is for your private use.
description:
Treat yourself to a modern getaway in a Stratus Suite at the South State Street! Enjoy the comforts and privacy of a light, airy apartment near the chicest galleries and gourmet cuisine.

Designed with the traveler in mind, this 2 Bedroom Stratus Suite (sleeps 6) caters to all your needs in a spacious layout with cool, natural decor that gives the Jade Suite a playful feel in a vibrant city. 

Stratus suites offer guests the comfort and style of a hotel without all the fuss. Complete with fresh furnishings and smart decor, each room is suited to the trendy traveler who craves comfort in new places. At the primary status level, the Stratus suite is ready to make you feel at home.

At a Glance

* Custom furnishings 
* Full and spacious kitchen
* Large flatscreen Smart TV
* Fast Internet 
*On the Art Walk
*Concierge services available from 9am to 10pm (central)

The entire apartment is for your private use.

This apartment is located within walking distance of McCormick Place Convention Center. It's also only a short drive to all tourist attractions, including the Field Museum, Shedd Aquarium, and Chicago Bean.

description:
Beautiful Townhome all to your self available. 3 bedrooms and 1 baths. Bronze ville area is 15 minutes to downtown Chicago.  Lots of restaurants and shopping a few minutes away. 3 queen size beds, 2 couches. Free parking on the street. This home can comfortably sleep 10  people. but you can use air mattresses to sleep more. TV fire-stick watch any live channel you want.

Stay in a nice townhome with  a full kitchen with all the amenities,  3 bedrooms with 3 queen size beds 2 couches, 1 full bath, living room, dining area and  a lovely backyard area. Parking in on the street is Free. There is no washer dryer in the unit but there is a laundry mat not to far away.

It’s likely you won’t see me during your stay, which allows you more privacy and convenience. However, I am here anytime you need to reach out. If you need anything or have questions, just send me a message via Airbnb and I’ll be quick to respond.

great location near highway and train easy access to downtown chicago. Close distance to restaurants and shops

Top things to do in Chicago area.

 Wrigley Field watch the chicago cubs play, ton of bars, restaurants, and nightlife

Sky Deck Willis tower downtown Chicago

the Bean at Millenium Park towner downtown Chicago

 Shedd Aquarium. Down town Chicago

 Rivers Casino Rosemont IL 

HorseShoe Casino Hammond IN
 Museum of Science and Industry Downtown Chicago 
Magnificent Mile down town chicago.
Maggie Daley Park. Downtown Chicago
Lincoln Park zoo Chicago IL
Lake Front trail for walking and biking. Beaches summer time. Down town Chicago 
 Field Museum for history. Down town Chicago
Chicago River Walk ton of shops and restaurants. Down town Chicago
 Chicago Cultural center. Down town Chicago
 Boat tours Down town Chicago

 Art Institute Down town Chicago
 360 Chicago Observatory Deck Down town Chicago
Richard H. Driehaus Museum Down town Chicago 
Symphony Center - Chicago Symphony Orchestra Down town Chicago 
United Center watch the Bulls, Blackhawks play
Comiskey Park watch the whitesox play

Taxis, Uber, and Lyft are available anytime and cost about $20 to get to anywhere else in town. I prefer Uber.   Also, the public bus stops are a few blocks away come every 15 minutes.

access: There are two entrances. A public entrance on 23rd street and a Private(preferred) entrance on Western. Two keys for entry that are accessible via lock box on side of building.
description:
one bedroom great for traveling artists or professionals. Located in Pilsen close to CTA pink line and 21 Cermak/49 Western Bus. 20 Minutes to downtown 30 mins to Wicker Park or Historical Hyde Park. With flexible check in times this space is geared towards offering a relaxed and creative environment during your time in Chicago. You never know what local artist may stop by. The space is reserved for 1 guest only. Any additional guest will be charged $250

This space is fully rehabbed, former financial office. Hardwood floors and stainless steel appliances. Located in the quieter area of Pilsen.

There are two entrances. A public entrance on 23rd street and a Private(preferred) entrance on Western. Two keys for entry that are accessible via lock box on side of building.

If you are a creative looking to connect and socialize with other creatives, I'd love to connect you, from music to visual art and food. However, only if you inquire. I like to let my guest roam freely. I’m a freelancer and unfortunately have very little capacity to show you around or make suggestions. I trust you’ve researched Chicago and will have a great time!

Close to CTA western Pink line stop. Chase bank, Pete’s fresh market, Walmart, Walgreens and various coffee shops all within walking distance.

24hr Free street parking available on Western Ave. Side street (23rd) becomes residential parking only from 6p-7a. Close access to #21 cermak bus which takes you into Chinatown and pink line train about 20mins into the loop and #49 Western Ave takes you north into Logan square.

access: We use a lockbox, check yourself with the secret code.
description:
The place is located in a secured area in West town. The apartment is spacious, have two bedroom, one shared bathroom, living room, kitchen, oven, microwave. The heart of downtown is 10min in car, 24 min CTA train, also do you have a CTA bus (public  transportation) in the corner.

 Bars, coffee shop and restaurants  close too.

This is an spacious and comfortable apartment with two bedrooms, you'll be sharing the apartment with my boyfriend and me. 

The place have a shared bedroom, kitchen, oven, big refrigerator, microwave, living room.
We have 1 real bed for two people and 1 air mattress. 

You can use everything in the house, you have included in you stay towels, shampoo, body soap, toothpaste, plates, etc.

We use a lockbox, check yourself with the secret code.

We live in the apartment but we work almost all day, if you need just tell us or write us, we will be happy to help you :)

We love do this thing's en Chicago, and we think that you will be love with this things too! 

Enjoy ;) 

You have to ride in the water taxi to see Chicago (economic option of the architecture tour)

  Chinatown (you arrive there in the water taxi)

  Eat pizzas in Giordanos or Gino's (I recommend Spinach dip Dish <3)

  Ride bike at lake 

 Walk on river walk

 Visit the Lincoln park zoo (free)

 Chicago greting (graffiti with name of Chicago)

 Walk the Michigan av.  (Shopping Avenue)

 * Places to have a drink and enjoy a beautiful view of the city *
 Cabana club
 The up room
 Cerise
 Cindys rooftop
 London house

 * Popular neighborhood *
 Fancy style: river North, west loops, old town, gold cost.
 Hipster and vintage style: wicker park, west town, Pilsen (18th street)

 * We love this place for go to eat. *
 Small sheval (Crazy burgers)

 Sushi taku (All you can eat sushi, 1904 W Division St, Chicago, IL 60622) 20$

 La Josie (Mexican gourmet, great coktails) 740 W Randolph St, Chicago, IL 60661

 Cantón Regio (Mexican food, 1510 W 18th St, Chicago, IL 60608)
 Ramen San

 Green market (delicius coffe)

 Green street smoked meats 112 N Green St, Chicago, IL 60607

 Fairgrounds coffe and te (Fulton market)
 SoHo house 113-125 N Green St, Chicago, IL

Great Chicago two unit building, beautiful  apartment with older tenants in first floor unit, newly rehabbed unit with private yard, front balcony access (private). Property managed by Licensed Real Estate Agent. 

Short walk from Lake Shore Drive, University of Chicago and the Museum of Science and Industry. Street parking and easy access to transportation (train and bus). 2nd floor unit (no elevator) open layout heat and air for comfort.

Management is only a phone call away.

Open Space, plenty of room to move around, Nice Balcony with space to sit and enjoy the weather.

Whole apartment, Living Room, Dining Room, Kitchen, Back Yard, Balcony, Community Garden.

We have opted to allow for maximum quiet enjoyment, please don't hesitate to call management if you need anything, 10 minutes away.

Neighborhood is Host to the following: University of Chicago, Museum of Science & Industry, New Obama Presidential Library, Washington Park and Jackson Park.

Plenty of free street parking in front.

Please clean up behind yourself. Thanks

access: Guests will have access to the entire unit.
description:
This luxury PH 2,000-sf condo with FREE PARKING is located in Chicago's South Loop / Bronzeville / Hyde Park. It's close to many Chicago highlights like sports parks (i.e. White Sox, Bears), galleries & museums (i.e. Gallery Guichard, Mus of Science & Industry, DuSable Mus), campuses (i.e. UofC, UofC Hospital, IIT, Illinois College of Optometry, etc.), and other attractions - Mag Mile, Lake, McCormick Place, Pres Obama's home! Near public transit.

Great for business and pleasure! Be our guest.

The apartment is located on the top penthouse floor of the building providing ample daylight, downtown skyline views, and is spacious enough to accommodate large and small groups, for business and pleasure!

Also, you'd be centrally located with easy access to Uber and mass transit including bus, train and bike lanes.  Plus, retail, groceries and restaurants are all in walking distance too!

Guests will have access to the entire unit.

I can be a phone call away, and will respond in less than an hour.

This entire neighborhood provides convenience - convenience for parking, traveling downtown, traveling to either Midway or O'Hare airport, nearby restaurants, mass transit, pleasant neighbors, historical structures, rich culture, walkable community, quick assess to Lake Shore Drive, and BIG ATTRACTIONS for the entire family like the lakefront, McCormick, a Bears game, a White Sox game, a Bulls game, Navy Pier and so much more!

There are (2) bus stops directly in front of the building that run far North through downtown and the Magnificent Mile, and south as well.  These buses also include "express service" buses heading downtown.  Also, (2) "L"/elevated trains are within walking distance that can connect you to Midway Airport, O'Hare Airport, and downtown Chicago.  Lastly, there are always taxis in the neighborhood, plus Uber and Lyft drivers minutes away, and the streets are lined with bike lanes.

Less than 10-min from McCormick Place driving, but why not walk, ride a bike or take one of the two buses that run from your front door directly to McCormick Place in less than 10-min!

Ask about special 10% discount!

While staying here, you'll have walking access to several retail restaurants and convenience/grocery stores, banks, the Lakefront, and so much more.  Most importantly, if you choose to drive, free parking is available at the building.

additional_house_rules:
- You agree to the following:
- 
- CHECK-IN: is on or after 5 PM unless otherwise agreed to in writing as our cleaning staff needs sufficient time to prepare. Arriving onsite earlier without approval is trespassing 
- KEYS: to return any access keys and remotes with a $50 replacement fee for every lost key and $250 for any remote or entry FOB
- BUILDING STAFF/NEIGHBORS: you understand that building staff DO NOT work for us and will not assist you. Do not bother them. We typically host guests staying 30+ nights who tend to be familiar with the premises. If you happen to be an exception, do not share reservation details or engage in any activity that will disturb the tranquility of this residential community. Contact me or my team for ALL questions or directions. We pick-up phones until midnight and are eager to help you 
- QUIET HOURS/DISTURBANCE: between 9 PM and 9 AM. No parties, drug use, or gatherings of any kind. Any additional occupants in excess of the # on your reservation must be approved by me whether in your unit or in common areas. Any damage from you or your guests will result in immediate expulsion, at an additional cost to you, a claim with Airbnb and subsequent legal action 
- SMOKING: whether inside your unit, in a common area or roof deck, no smoking of any substance is allowed. Smoke damage to a unit will result in a $1000 fee
- PETS: you understand pets are not allowed in your unit. Pet damage may result in additional fees
- MISSING ITEMS: will be charged to you in a claim 
- ID CHECK: per the rules of this community, we'll request you submit your Government Issued Photo ID at the time of your e-check in via our site. You'll have to also agree to our terms of service. We're required to do a public records check for certain communities
- BREACH: any violation of the above shall result in immediate removal from the property at an additional cost to you
- BOOKING WITHIN 24 HRS: We'll send a request for a $500-1000 deposit which shall be fully returned on checkout

description:
Gorgeous 2BD/2BA Unit in the heart of Chicago - Rivernorth. Professionally managed and cleaned with stylish kitchen, free high-speed wifi and 24/7 support. Fully stocked with all the convenience you would expect at a hotel.

We are available to assist you with absolutely anything you need through midnight, 7 days a week

Cozy and modern apartment units situated along Chicago's River North District. A few minutes away from the Chicago Riverwalk, the Puerto Convention Center and the Shedd Aquarium, along with hundreds of art galleries and local museums. The brown and the purple lines are the main mode of transportation in the city. Amenities include a 24Hr fitness center, a business center with wifi hot spots, hospitable accommodation and a rooftop swimming pool. All units include a modern kitchen, floor to ceiling windows, in-unit washer/dryers and flat screen TV's. Free fast wifi, kitchen/cookware and bathroom amenities are also provided. For any concerns, our amazing customer support team is available to assist.

We offer rewards and complimentary upgrades to our regular repeat guests

access:
Entire Private Apartment
All Amenities
All of Downtown Chicago at your Doorstep!
description:
Randolph Tower Studio is located in the theater district of the loop. Enjoy stunning views of the city from your apartment before walking to work from this centrally located loop apartment. In your free time enjoy Michigan Avenue for shopping, as well as museums, restaurants and nightlife at your doorstep. The train, taxis, and buses are all accessible on the same block for even more convenience.

Modern. Clean. All-Inclusive.  Enjoy stunning city views from floor to ceiling windows while having the luxury of premiere shopping, dining, and big city attractions at your doorstep. This spacious apartment with 9 ft. ceilings includes a designer kitchen with granite countertops and kitchen islands, King Bed, stainless steel appliances, custom wood-plank flooring, custom closets with shelving and a wall mounted shoe rack in-unit storage, individually controlled heating/cooling and in-unit washer and dryer.

This 24-hour doorman building is a historic landmark. The building amenities include an expansive lounge area, bike storage, business center and conference room, concierge service, dry cleaning/laundry service, hot tub and indoor pool, on-site restaurant and pet facilities. 

Arrive with just your suitcase and we handle everything else for you.  Your automated monthly payment includes all furnishings, linens, kitchen and household items, high speed wireless Internet, all utilities, cable TV with flat screen TV/s, access to all amenities, 24-hour maintenance and 24-hour customer service.   We offer month to month contracts with a 31 night minimum and a 14 day notice to vacate.  Parking and maid service are available, and apartment prices depend on your dates of stay.  Book today to start your Chicago experience!

Entire Private Apartment
All Amenities
All of Downtown Chicago at your Doorstep!

24-Hour Maintenance 
24-Hour Customer Support

As Chicago's official downtown area, the Loop is one of the most important central business districts on the globe. In addition to its dynamic architecture and buzzing atmosphere, the area has an incredible concentration of cultural institutions, urban park spaces, award-winning restaurants and a shopper's paradise on State Street.
Famous for its striking architecture, the Loop vaunts signature buildings by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe and Louis Henri Sullivan, as well as Aqua by modern day prodigy Jeanne Gang. The area hangout, Millennium Park, complements its surrounding with stunning architectural marvels of its own. The park's crown jewels include a Frank Gehry-designed amphitheater and Cloud Gate, the landmark "Bean" that's become an iconic symbol of Chicago. Nearby Maggie Daley Park and the Chicago Riverwalk are two new engaging outdoor spaces that embrace design — and fun!
In addition to architectural marvels, Chicago's cultural attractions also have a prevailing presence in the downtown Loop. The celebrated Theater District buzzes with Tony Award-winning shows and glittering marquees. The Chicago Cultural Center provides an incredible range of performance and visual arts, while the Art Institute of Chicago is widely considered to be one of the finest institutions of its kind in the world.

Easy bus, train and taxi access. Close to highway.
Walk to Everything!

31 Night Minimum Stay
Parking and Maid Service Available for a Fee
Pet-Friendly Apartments Available for a $500 One-Time Pet Fee
Terms and Conditions Document Sent at Booking for Electronic Signature
Late Check-Out Available 1PM for $40. (Otherwise 11AM Check-Out)
Early Check-In Available 1PM for $40 (Otherwise 3PM Check-In)
Charge for an additional night or all costs associated with failure to check-out if not checked out by 11AM or Late Check-Out Purchased.
$30 Lock-Out Fee after 9PM.
interaction:
24-Hour Maintenance 
24-Hour Customer Support

access: The Speakeasy is two floors of common area, second floor will be a beautiful art gallery open to all. Feel free to wander the two spacious floors here at the speakeasy, please know we are restoring the space to its original feel, and work is going on during your visit. Thank you for your understanding.
description:
Note:
Check-in is at noon but you can come as early as you need and pick up the keys will drop off your bags.
This is room number 4A and your keys will be marked 4A. We are Restoring an Authentic Chicago Speakeasy from the 1920s to its former glory and you are welcome to come stay. Your private room is completely restored, the bathrooms are completely adequate, see photos, they are being improved upon every day. 
$50 additional fee per person for third and fourth guests staying in the room.
PLEASE NOTE:
 Common areas are being restored! We will be doing painting cleaning and some lightweight Construction during the day.
Thank you. 
Feel free to walk around the two floors and observe the work being done to restore this old Jewel from a bygone era. Welcome

Your room number is 4A and your keys will be marked 4A. Your room is a beautifully restored 20 by 12 foot room with 11 foot ceilings. We have layered rugs and original art and antiques throughout the room to create a beautiful ambiance for you day and night. Please note as of August 1st through August 15th bathrooms will be shared. After which bathrooms will be private. Enjoy

The Speakeasy is two floors of common area, second floor will be a beautiful art gallery open to all. Feel free to wander the two spacious floors here at the speakeasy, please know we are restoring the space to its original feel, and work is going on during your visit. Thank you for your understanding.

We have one other private room that may be occupied during your stay, it's a great chance to meet people from all around the world.

We are in the middle of beautiful River North Chicago which is exploding with fabulous restaurants discos and game rooms. Google River North for food and entertainment it is endless, everything is within walking distance. The famous Boss Bar is on the corner loud and rambunctious. Just around the corner on Hubbard Street Fat Babies tacos delicious, just across the street from fat babies is Hubbard Inn one of my favorite rooms in the city everything is good there. Firecakes for Gourmet Donuts just east on Hubbard. Lyfe kitchen all organic and reasonably priced for downtown is just across the street.
World famous Frontera Grill, and don't miss the Gourmet Sandwiches at xoco on the corner of Clark and Illinois and So much more.
Enjoy.

Chicago has fabulous public transportation. We are close to the red brown and blue line trains, buses on every street, rapid Uber Lyft and taxi response time. we are within walking distance of the brand new Riverwalk just two streets over, and 6 streets from Millennium Park. Navy Pier is just down Illinois Street past the Magnificent Mile of Michigan Avenue. We are centrally located within walking distance of almost everything great this city has to offer.

My son Todd is the manager and lives on the second floor, he manages the speakeasy and it's rehab. Feel free to ask him anything you might need to know about the Speakeasy or the city. We are in the middle of the beautiful and vibrant River North section of the city.
Any questions or requests feel free to call me. 312.452.5213

additional_house_rules:
House Rules

1.  Please be respectful of our neighbors.  No excessive noises and no parties.  

1-a.  If you are going to park in the reserved spot please let me know your make/model and license plate.

2.  Please take off your shoes.  I'm asian and that's what we do in the house =)  High heels make divots on the wood floors, so please do not wear them in the condo.

3.  No smoking in the condo or on the patio.

4.  Please do not overload the washer or dryer.  

5.  If you use the washer please keep the door open so that the inside of the machine dries properly.

6.  If the garbage is full there are extra bags under the sink.  The community garbage bins are around the back of the apartment, near the parking lot.

7.  Please turn off lights and make sure the patio door is locked when leaving the condo.

8.  Sheets are cleaned after each guest.  If you have time please take off the sheets and put them in the bedroom hamper.

9.  Turning on the bathroom vent prevents excess moisture from building up, please use it when taking a shower

10.  Please rinse the dishes & cups prior to placing them in the dishwasher.  Dishwasher detergent is located under the sink.

11.  Please do not overload the garbage disposal in the sink (small amounts of left over food are ok; eggshells and chunks of meat and veggies are not)

12.  Please turn off A/C or heat when leaving the apartment.

13.  As a reminder, we don't allow pets in the condo. Thanks!
