access: Guests will have full access to the whole apartment.  There is a private patio, free reserved parking onsite, use of the kitchen, & use of the washer/dryer.
description:
Heart of Lincoln Park.  Steps away from Lincoln Park Zoo & Lake Michigan.  Minutes from Brown Line & Halsted St shopping, restaurants, bars, & night life.  Divvy Bike Share station across the street.  Free parking onsite.  Free wifi & cable tv.  Propane Grill in private patio.

Bosch Washer Dryer in Unit.  Full Kitchen with Granite Counter Tops & Walk In Shower.  Very comfortable Queen bed in Master Bedroom.  Large living room with free WiFi & cable.

Guests will have full access to the whole apartment.  There is a private patio, free reserved parking onsite, use of the kitchen, & use of the washer/dryer.

Lincoln Park is one of the best places to visit when in Chicago.  Minutes from Lincoln Park Zoo, Lake Michigan, Magnificent Mile, and the best of what Chicago has to offer.

Chicago's premier Bike Share program is right across the street (Divvy Station).  10 minute walk to the Brown and Purple Line.
house_rules:
House Rules

1.  Please be respectful of our neighbors.  No excessive noises and no parties.  

1-a.  If you are going to park in the reserved spot please let me know your make/model and license plate.

2.  Please take off your shoes.  I'm asian and that's what we do in the house =)  High heels make divots on the wood floors, so please do not wear them in the condo.

3.  No smoking in the condo or on the patio.

4.  Please do not overload the washer or dryer.  

5.  If you use the washer please keep the door open so that the inside of the machine dries properly.

6.  If the garbage is full there are extra bags under the sink.  The community garbage bins are around the back of the apartment, near the parking lot.

7.  Please turn off lights and make sure the patio door is locked when leaving the condo.

8.  Sheets are cleaned after each guest.  If you have time please take off the sheets and put them in the bedroom hamper.

9.  Turning on the bathroom vent prevents excess moisture from building up, please use it when taking a shower

10.  Please rinse the dishes & cups prior to placing them in the dishwasher.  Dishwasher detergent is located under the sink.

11.  Please do not overload the garbage disposal in the sink (small amounts of left over food are ok; eggshells and chunks of meat and veggies are not)

12.  Please turn off A/C or heat when leaving the apartment.

13.  As a reminder, we don't allow pets in the condo. Thanks!

access: Master bath with a newly renovated master bath, large 2nd bathroom with exceptional 2nd floor views and sitting area. The space has a big kitchen with a table for 4 and a nice size living room. New carpet thru-out and super clean. The 2nd bathroom has just been completely updated with new shower, flooring, sink and tiolet. You will lve the safe area and the many countless downtown Skokie amenities. One suburb North of Chicago and 20 minutes from O'Hare Airport. We are Super Host and look forward to your booking.
description:
This fabulous historic apartment is within walking distance to a multitude of different restaurants from fine dining, local pizza, to coffee shops, bakery, farmers market, museums, Skokie theater, grocery store, public transportation to Wrigley Field & Chicago, public library, pool, and cigar lounge. You’ll love this clean, smoke free property, because of the cozy ambiance, safe neighborhood, and peaceful comfy beds. It's private, great for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

This space has 2 newly renovated bathrooms with an exceptional dine-in kitchen. This p second floor apartment with it's own private entrance has been brought back to it's 1877 original look. Incredible Moldings with 88 inch windows allow for full sun and glowing mornings. Enjoy this spacious family room with a wide screen T.V. The hot water radiators make this place cozy and toasty. You will have your own space with a private entrance and free parking in the booming downtown epi-center. Close to the Skokie Swift and a quick ride downtown or Wrigley Field (25 min)...$3/ride.

Master bath with a newly renovated master bath, large 2nd bathroom with exceptional 2nd floor views and sitting area. The space has a big kitchen with a table for 4 and a nice size living room. New carpet thru-out and super clean. The 2nd bathroom has just been completely updated with new shower, flooring, sink and tiolet. You will lve the safe area and the many countless downtown Skokie amenities. One suburb North of Chicago and 20 minutes from O'Hare Airport. We are Super Host and look forward to your booking.

Safe neighborhood with easy street parking, well lit and close to downtown restaurants, coffee house, churches, Village Hall and Skokie Library.

Free street parking and a free parking lot across the street.

Quick access to Downtown Chicago, Skokie Holocaust Museum, Northwestern University, The North Shore Suburbs, O'Hare Airport, Wrigley Field and Evanston. We are also a few blocks from the Edens Expressway if you need to drive downtown or up to Wisconsin.

additional_house_rules:
Quiet scholarly environment. Quiet hours from 9 pm to 6 am. Guests are expected to clean up after themselves. Light cooking ONLY please. This includes toaster oven, microwave, easy skillet prep or quick oven things like pizza. No oven use during summer months or when it is very warm outside. No pets allowed. Smoking only allowed in backyard outside. Guests are asked to use shower caddy for all bathroom essentials they may have including toothbrush and so on. Common areas are closed at 9 pm. Kitchen closed for cooking at 9pm but microwave, toaster oven, kettle, coffee pot and quiet things are fine. I just ask that you’re courteous of others sleeping. Food stored in refrigerator must be kept in proper containers with lids. Must be a registered guest to be on premises. 



Please be aware that this particular location has two beautiful well behaved German Shepherds.   I have other locations that are very close by five blocks away, where we do not have any animals on site. This is my personal residence and if you are not a dog lover this would not be the best listing for you. Please review my other listings where animals are not on site

Beautiful room located in a safe and upscale area. New bed, dresser, area for clothing, and lots of light. This wonderful Home is an easy walk to downtown Forest Park, Oak Park and River Forest. Located minutes from public transportation! Great space for anyone looking for a clean and comfortable environment. Close to Stroger, Rush, and Loyola! Easy 20 minute ride to downtown on the conveniently close Blue line or Green Line.

Spacious and clean home located in an ideal spot for all of your travel and work needs! The room is fresh and spacious with clean new bedding and lots of storage.

Wonderful fully stocked kitchen and cozy living space makes this home feel like yours the minute you walk in!

The neighborhood is safe and one of a kind. You'll find many delicious restaurants, fun shops and plenty of unique things to check out!

Close walk to all forms of public transportation (BLUE LINE - GREEN LINE - CTA BUS - PACE BUS) you'll find it effortless to get to your desired destination! Parking is also available nearby for an additional fee.

access: As a guest, you have access to a comfortable, queen size bed, full kitchen, on site laundry facility, free wifi, and an awesome host who will recommend you places to visit, attractions to see in Chicago.
description:
Looking to explore Chicago and setup your expedition base-camp in the best and safest neighborhood of Chicago? Look no further! Close to transport, lake, parks, running trails, grocery stores, restaurants, museums,  nightlife, downtown, summer market, and much more. Well equipped entire small studio is just for you. Studio is not shared with the host or any other guests. Flexible on dates and prices, just ask. For long term stays 30 or more days - contact me prior to booking.

Well equipped small studio makes a perfect stay for a short visit or somebody traveling on a budget.

As a guest, you have access to a comfortable, queen size bed, full kitchen, on site laundry facility, free wifi, and an awesome host who will recommend you places to visit, attractions to see in Chicago.

I will be always present at the time of check in to make sure you find my building and answer any questions you might have. As always, you can call my cell any time of the day with questions or recommendations.

During the summer, Farmers Market is every Saturday and Sunday on Division street. Follow Dearborn down to Division st and turn RIGHT/West. Fresh produce from local growers delivered from across the state.

I'd recommend CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) for their well planned and time accurate bus/train schedules. DIVVY bike rentals are a blast as well - closest rental kiosk is across Chicago History Museum just few minutes away from the Basecamp.

Early/Later check-in, check-out
I'm very flexible and try to accommodate my guest's requests when possible. If you see on the calendar there are no reservations the day before your arrival - this means early check-in is possible, same goes for the check-out time; check the calendar closer to the date or your arrival, confirm with me and I'd be more then happy to accommodate.

access: You have full access to the unit.  If you need to check in before 3:00, I am very accommodating to accept your luggage while you hit the town.
description:
This space is located in the heart of one of the most exciting neighborhoods in Chicago! It is a loft space with 10 foot ceilings, original tin ceiling tiles, hardwood floors, and a ladder up to the loft with beds. It has a small refrigerator, microwave, hot and cold spring water dispenser, and closed bathroom with a stand up shower. 
It is an interior design studio during the week and designed accordingly.
There is potential for noise from the surrounding bars & neighbor (I provide ear plugs).

This loft space has a very unique, hip, and eccentric city vibe designed and curated by professional interior designers.

You have full access to the unit.  If you need to check in before 3:00, I am very accommodating to accept your luggage while you hit the town.

I provide all kinds of recommendations for all over the city.

Forbed named Wicker Park in the top 4 of 'Hippest Neighborhoods' in the country (next to Silver Lake, CA and Williamsburg, Brooklyn).

Across the street from the Blue Line stop; buses on every corner going all directions; free parking by Wicker Park Park - nearby

description:
The small room is within walking distance to the University of Chicago and President Obama's home is footsteps away. It is along University of Chicago's free evening shuttle bus route for students and faculty living near campus. Simply board next to university's main library and get dropped off a 1 minute walk away. This shuttle runs every 30 minutes from 5 pm to 4 am. Additionally, the # 2 bus to downtown is also a 1 minute walk from the apartment.

Location: Ellis Ave and East Hyde Park Blvd

access: Amazing private garden.  Great proximity to downtown, The United Center and public transportation.  Free secure, gated parking.  Bike share program around the corner.
description:
This huge, light soaked, 2 bedroom has room for everyone! Located close enough to the city to be convenient but quiet.  The train is a five minute walk and takes you downtown in 12 minutes.  Enjoy the half acre secret, private garden & the earthy art scene that's thriving in this unique community. It's pure grit & glory!  Only a short walk to the amazing Garfield Park Conservatory.  Uber to The United Center for a concert or game for under $10!

This is such an unusual location.  312 Whipple is an artist community that has been thriving and feeding the Chicago Art Scene for 25 years.  It's a gem tucked secretly in a secure gated block with access to an unprecedented amount of outdoor space.  The gardens alone are enchanting.  Visit some authentic live/work studios or catch an exhibit if you can!

Amazing private garden.  Great proximity to downtown, The United Center and public transportation.  Free secure, gated parking.  Bike share program around the corner.

Come share a beer or do your own thing... You name it.

We want to under promise and over deliver.  So we want to be clear that this property is on Chicago's West side in an amazing multicultural and ethnically diverse neighborhood.  It is, for sure in the inner city.  It's full of grime and glory.  You can't walk to a coffee shop but you can make eye contact and chit chat with a total stranger. Not many places in a big city where that happens anymore.  If you're not used to big cities, do a street view to make sure it's in your comfort zone.  Or, step outside of your comfort zone and have a fantastic new experience.  Isn't that one of the best parts of travel!?

2 minute walk to The Metra. 6 minutes to the CTA which can have you any place in the city.  One of the biggest pluses is our proximity to public transportation.  Also a quick walk to the Chicago DIVY... our fantastic bike share program.  Bike downtown in 15 to 30 minutes depending on location and biking ability.  Uber to either airport for about $15.

Check in 3:00 pm
Check out promptly by 11am please.
Don't forget to leave keys on the island
Possible to drop bags after 11:30am.  We are pet friendly but do have a pet fee of $15/per pet. Please let us know if you will be traveling with your pet.
house_rules:
No Fire
No Vomit
No Anger
Number of guests in the unit must be the same number of guests on the reservation at all times.  
Music played at a volume that your grandmother would tolerate.  If she is deaf or hardcore, than a level that my grandmother would tolerate.  Keep the dial in the middle or lower!! 

Please keep heat set between 60 and 70.  Please close all windows and lower heat to 60 A/C to 75 upon checking out.  Mother Earth thanks you!

additional_house_rules:
Very simply, please respect my home and my neighbors. Please read these rules carefully and take them seriously, failure to comply will result in forfeiture of your deposit and/or termination of your reservation without a refund. 

1.) No parties or additional overnight guests without prior approval. Noise disturbances reported by neighbors or police are unacceptable.
2.) Please ensure you have left the premises and returned any keys issued to you by the agreed upon check out time. Failure to do so will result in a $250 late check-out fee. 
3.) No smoking (of anything) inside the unit or on building premises unless you are in a designated smoking area.  Additionally, Chicago law prohibits smoking within 15 feet of any building entrance. 
4.) Please be respectful of my neighbors and be mindful of noise and loud music. Please observe quiet hours from 10:00 PM-8:00 AM daily. 
5.) Pets are not allowed at the property unless previously approved and pet fee paid.
6.) Lockouts will result in a $150 fee per occurrence.  Additionally, lost keys will incur a $50 per key fee.

description:
*SPECIAL* Jan-Feb Stay 7+ nights at 20% off OR 30+ at 25% off! 

Our two-bedroom condo is in the heart of Lakeview but so quiet you might forget you're even in the city! We're on a residential street but just a quick walk to everything the neighborhood (and the city!) has to offer - including Wrigley Field - and in a quaint building with friendly neighbors. You'll feel right at home making coffee and breakfast here before jumping into whatever Chicago adventures you have planned - book today!

You enter our condo into an open living and kitchen space that features bay windows to the street, and a patio door to the shared deck off the kitchen. Our kitchen is recently updated and has plenty of counter space, and there's an in-unit washer and dryer in it. Beyond the living space are two bedrooms, both with queen beds.

Anchored by a beautiful stretch of shoreline to the east and dotted with train stops from two ‘L' lines, Lakeview is one of Chicago's liveliest and most accessible neighborhoods. Several distinct areas — East Lakeview, Central Lakeview, Boystown and Wrigleyville — meld together to form a lakefront community that celebrates diversity and boasts something for every type of visitor.

We're a quick walk to the red line, and just off multiple bus lines. It's only about a half-hour on the CTA to the Loop, and a 15 minute walk to Wrigley Field - you won't have any trouble getting around town without a car from here.

access: The guests have full access to the studio and all out door spaces. If they would like to grill, I ask to be notified in advance (as much as possible) so I can make sure the tools are provided. I have gas and charcoal grills. Fire pits need to be approved.
description:
This home is a spacious studio with high wood beam ceilings, granite floors and industrial steel work.  There is a private entrance through the patio with a fire pit and two grills that guests are welcome to use.  The studio is located next to The 606 trail which is great for walking, running and biking.  Historical and beautiful Humboldt Park is just a block away.  There are also fantastic dining and drinking options equally close.

The guests have full access to the studio and all out door spaces. If they would like to grill, I ask to be notified in advance (as much as possible) so I can make sure the tools are provided. I have gas and charcoal grills. Fire pits need to be approved.

I live in the main home located on the property but respect privacy and space if that is what the guest would like. That is their call to make and I will follow their lead. I rarely run into my guests. The couch house is a separate structure from the main house located above the garage.

My neighborhood is known for it's boulevard system and has a lot of green and trees. Check out Humboldt Park which is one of the best parks in the city in my opinion. I love to walk, jog and have picnics there. The 606 trail is located a block away. It is an old elevated rail line that was transformed for recreation. It has bike lanes and I do have extra bikes for guests. It is also great for walking as it connects three neighborhoods and is a uniques way to see some of Chicago. The jogging lanes are the same material as a running track. There are amazing restaurants and bars within walking distance or a short car ride away. I have information on some of my favorites in the guest binder.

Street parking has no restrictions except for the following:

April - December: Street cleaning occurs on the third Tuesday of the month from 7-4. Check for signs as that will indicate where street cleaning is scheduled. You will be ticketed if your car is parked in any zones during street cleaning.

Snow: If it snows more than 2 inches, the city expects cars to be moved in order for snow plow trucks to be able to clean effectively.

Extra linens are located in trunk for the bed and the couch.

access: Guests may respectfully use all common spaces
description:
Catmandu bedroom #1:
Private en suite with comfy Queen size bed and a loveseat sitting area that pulls out to a single size bed if needed.

Welcome to Catmandu! 

My home is located in the lovely suburbs of Chicago and is close to shopping, forest preserves, and has close access to the Heritage Corridor train in Willow Springs, (approximately 2.1 miles) which will take you to and from Chicago but does not run on the weekends. My home is also near the Burlington Northern Santa Fe (BNSF) train station (approximately 7 miles) which will take you to and from Chicago 7 days a week. 

My home is located approximately 10 miles from Midway International Airport and 20 miles from O'Hare International Airport. Pickup and/or dropoff to the airports or city can be arranged for an additional fee. Otherwise, Uber can be used via their app in this area. 

Restaurants:
There is American, Chinese, Italian, Mexican, Seafood, Portillo's, Giordano's pizza, and cocktail bar all within 1.5 - 10 miles away. 

Activities:
Little Red Schoolhouse Nature Center is 3.8 miles away.
Palos Trail System for running and biking is 3.8 miles away. 
Waterfall Glen Forest Preserve is also 3.8 miles away. 
The Brookfield Zoo is approximately 10 miles from my home. 
The Lincoln Park Zoo, Field Museum, Art Institute of Chicago and Shed Aquarium are all roughly 20 miles from my home. 
There is an AMC movie theater as close as 5 miles and many more after that. 

Shopping:
Burr Ridge Village Center  - 2.5 miles 
Oakbrook Center  - 10 miles 
Orland Square Mall  - 11 miles 
And many others.

My home is located 4 miles from access to I-55 and I-294.
With multiple gas stations roughly 2-3 miles away.

Guests may respectfully use all common spaces

As much or as little as you'd like! Regardless, I will be in the house in case something is needed.

Lovely home located close to forest preserves, shopping, and train acess to Chicago

Parking in the private driveway is preferred.

There will be $300 fine breaking this rule •CHECK IN is any time after 3 pm. CHECK OUT is any time before 12 noon. You're welcome to request an early check in or late checkout, but this is not guaranteed and we can only confirm 24 hours in advance. •NO guest allowed more than the maximum capacity of 5. •NO parties with excessive noise allowed.  Please respect our neighbors by observing sleeping hours. No overnight guests who are not part of the advanced, Airbnb reservation WITHOUT PERMISSION from host.  •Please NO DAMAGE to the whole unit being occupied. Maintain cleanliness, throw all trash before leaving the property.  Trash bin is in the back of the building by the alley.  No throwing of sanitary napkins to toilet. No damage to hardwood floors.  If our home is left in an exceptionally messy state, we will charge $40 for every extra hour of cleaning required. •Please use the kitchen freely but clean any mess that is created, including dishes, counter, stove, oven toaster, microwave, no dirty dishes should be left in the sink upon check out.  Please do not eat in the bedrooms and bathrooms. •Please conserve energy by turning off lights, small appliances, lamps, etc. when not being used. •Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries, or illnesses that occur while on the premises.  By accepting this reservation, it is agreed that all guests are expressly assuming the risk of any harm arising from their use of the premises.

access: All units doors front and back are digital door locks. We will provide detailed instructions and codes a day before arrival. The main building door uses key to enter. It’s on a coded lockbox.
description:
Cozy, newly updated and decorated 2 bedrooms, 1 bathroom condominium with spacious kitchen and a cozy living room. The condo is located in Albany Park with ample restaurants  within walking distance. It is a second floor unit in a 3 story, 20 unit condominium  building. Free permit street parking is first come and first served, so not always available. Steps from bus stop and about a quarter mile  from the brown line station to Chicago downtown. Easily accessible to downtown, 30 - 40 minutes.

Newly updated two unit condo, beautifully furnished.

All units doors front and back are digital door locks. We will provide detailed instructions and codes a day before arrival. The main building door uses key to enter. It’s on a coded lockbox.

I'm accessible to phone and email. Proper instructions are given for easy access to building.

Albany Park is located on the Northwest Side of the City of Chicago , it is one of the most ethnically diverse in the United States. As one of Chicago's most ethnically diverse neighborhoods, it boasts an unmatched array of multicultural restaurants, including local favorite Noon-O-Kabab and the celebrated falafel of Semiramis. 

Along the Lawrence Avenue corridor, you will discover independently-owned grocery stores, delicious Korean cuisine and a collection of highly regarded Middle Eastern and Mexican restaurants.

But Albany Park is more than delicious Pad Thai and perfectly roasted kabobs. This charming community vaunts year-round musical and stage performances by the Albany Park Theater Project.

Albany Park is accessible through the Kimball station of the Brown Line, the Montrose CTA Blue Line Station, as well as by the Edens expressway (Interstate 94).

The Chicago Transit Authority's Brown Line terminates at Lawrence and Kimball Avenues. Albany Park is accessible through the Kimball, Kedzie and Francisco stations of the Brown Line, the Montrose CTA Blue Line Station, as well as by the Edens expressway (Interstate 94). 

CTA bus routes in Albany Park include: #53 Pulaski, #78 Montrose, #80 Irving Park, #81 Lawrence, #82 Kimball/Homan and #92 Foster.

We have Smart TV to access your account in Netflix, Amazon, Hulu. etc. It has Xfinity basic TV connection. We have high speed Comcast internet/Wi-Fi connection.

access: Guest have access to entire duplex, except for any cabinets and closets with locks on it.
description:
Spacious 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom Duplex, is located in the thriving urban heart of chicago. We are close to trendy shops, fine dining, bars and only 10 min from downtown, most importantly the large beautiful park, enjoy bike riding, tennis and jogging.

Feel like home in my spacious duplex condo, my duplex is very comfortable, clean and up-to-date accommodations, the top floor features a joint living room and kitchen, complete with fireplace, balcony and modern appliances. Our downstairs basement is equipped with a spectacular pool table, projector screen and a brand new bar. The duplex has 3 fully furnished bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. This amazing duplex comfortably sleeps 10 providing two additional BLOW UP BEDS, one queen and one full size bed. Also those who enjoy a nice workout we offer a  fitness room with a treadmill, Bowflex, exercise bike and weights.  Also don't forget to relax on the back deck and grill up some burgers on our charcoal  barbecue grill. You can't leave without checking out Chicago's Brand New 606 Bike trail that take you for a tour of some of the best neighborhoods in the city divvy bike rental only a block away, So comeout and enjoy all I have to offer...

Guest have access to entire duplex, except for any cabinets and closets with locks on it.

I like to meet my guest upon arrival, then provide a tour of the unit, any issues arise I'm always one phone call away..

We love our neighborhood,  it's very walkable and close to transportation.  There are rental bike stations within a block as well. We have tons of great restaurants, bars and were only 10 minutes from downtown.

description:
This is a private room in a two-bedroom apartment. Restaurants, shops, and bars are all within walking distance. Downtown is a 12-minute train ride away via the adjacent Armitage Brown Line station.

Trove guests have exclusive FREE access to The Metropolitan, a members-only club located on the 66th and 67th floors of the Willis Tower. Check "Exclusive Trove Perks" in the listing description for details.

Thanks so much for your interest in staying with us! We've hosted hundreds of guests over the last few years and are very proud of the excellent feedback we've received. We know that the key to our success has been setting proper expectations for our guests; each listing on Airbnb is unique and every host has a different hosting style. We ask that you read through our entire listing to make sure that we're a good fit for you.

Our lovely home is the perfect place for your group to stay in while you explore all that the city has to offer. There are 2 bedrooms in the apartment and both are listed on Airbnb. 

Also in the apartment:
• Keyless Entry
• Fully equipped kitchen
• One bathroom
• Keurig coffee maker
• Tea-making supplies
• High-speed internet
• HDTV w/ Netflix

We're conveniently located next to a CTA "L" stop, so making your way around Chicago is incredibly easy. The Loop is a short 15 minute train ride away.

WHY STAY WITH TROVE?

⭐ Fast Communication
We’re always on call to answer your questions, typically within 30 minutes.

⭐ Experienced Hosts
We’ve hosted thousands of guests over five years.

⭐ Exclusive Perks
Trove Guests have access to the Metropolitan Club, located in the Willis Tower.

⭐ Easy Self-Check-In
Keyless access means no keys for you manage during your stay!

⭐ Central Location
You’ll never be far from local spots to check out, sights to see, and public transit.

We’re located on the north side of Chicago in Lincoln Park, one of Chicago’s trendiest and safest neighborhoods. Our neighborhood is a wonderful mix of bustling streets packed with local restaurants and shops, as well as quiet tree-lined streets full of historic buildings. We’re also minutes away from many of Chicago’s most popular spots.

Because of our central location, we recommend leaving your car at home. Any point of interest in Chicago can easily be reached by walking, public transit, or Uber.

→ The Armitage Brown Line 'L' train station is next door.
→ O'Hare is 50 minutes away via public transit and 30-45 minutes away via Uber.
→ Midway is 60 minutes away via public transit and 35-50minutes away via Uber.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

1. “How do I get to ‘x’ from the apartment?/How far is the apartment from ‘x’?”

Directions from our apartment to any point in the city are available via web search. We're adjacent to the Armitage 'L' train station. Search for “Armitage Brown Line station Chicago” in Maps, click the “Directions” button, then enter your point of interest.

2. “Is there parking nearby?”

Parking in Chicago is often difficult and even more so in the evening and during special events. We recommend using a service called SpotHero because it allows you to reserve a nearby paid parking spot in advance so that you don’t have to worry about finding parking when you arrive.

3. When is check-in/check-out?

Check-in is 3 p.m. or later but you're welcome to stop by anytime after 11:30 a.m. to drop off your bags in the living room.

Check-out is at 11 a.m. Our cleaning staff will need access to the apartment at 11 a.m., but you’re welcome to leave your bags in the living room and pick them up by 2:30 p.m. at the latest.

4. “Can a third person stay in the room with me?”

We allow a maximum of two guests per room. We have additional rooms available if you need accommodations for more than two people. Send us a message for more info.

access: The whole unit is offered and there is also a coin washer and dryer in the basement. Just ask for coinage!
description:
Enter this bright, airy apt., with soaring 10 ft. ceilings, beautiful hardwood floors and welcoming decor and you'll feel right at home.
It's filled with period details yet equipped with modern conveniences, from the crown moldings to the lovely, large white kitchen open to a charming family room. Just add 2 comfy bedrooms and 2 full baths to call it complete.
The location cannot be beat. Steps to all transportation, Chicago's best sights, restaurants and bars are all right outside your door.

This unit is walking distance to the lake, Wrigley Field, the EL and a host of other points of interest.

The whole unit is offered and there is also a coin washer and dryer in the basement. Just ask for coinage!

I own the building and live there as well, so I will meet and greet or a colleague will and I am happy to be of help in any way possible, whether it's assistance in navigating the city or finding the best BYOB restaurant in the neighborhood.

Seriously, I may be biased after having lived here for so many years, but it is the best neighborhood in this great city. We access the whole city in a short time, whether on foot, train or bus and it's outrageously safe. Groceries, restaurants, blues clubs, theaters, etc. are all nearby.
I can't imagine living anywhere else.

The Brown Line EL is a block and a half away, buses are all nearby and if one is a walker, you are at the lake in 15 minutes or on the Magnificent Mile in about 45 minutes on foot.

There are a couple of important rules, the most being there is absolutely no smoking anywhere in or near the building. One of the residents is highly allergic to the smell of nicotine or smoke of any kind. So sorry.

We do ask that people leave their shoes at the door and we provide comfy socks to pad about in. It's a historical landmark, which means all wood joists between floors and so it's a bit noisy with shoes.
We also ask that no candles be lit.

Please note:
Owner shall not be liable for damage or loss to persons or property while guests/renters are on premises at 831 W. Wellington Ave, Chicago, IL 60657.

Thanks!

access: The entire level is yours to enjoy, plus the backyard!
description:
This house is located in historic Logan Square. The space is a newly renovated basement apartment of an owner-occupied two-flat. It's right next to Palmer Square which is a two acre park with a jogging path, kids area, and benches. It's a perfect place to have a picnic or go for a run. The neighborhood is very walking-friendly and there's tons of great shops and restaurants in the area. It has an open floor-plan with two beds, a full bathroom, and kitchenette.

-Private, spacious open floor plan
-3 blocks away from the CTA blue line
-Wi-fi included
-Private entrance
-Basic furnishings
-Roku HDTV (free Netflix)
-Kitchenette has a fridge, microwave, & coffee maker

The entire level is yours to enjoy, plus the backyard!

We live two floors up, so if you ever need anything during your stay let us know and we'll be able to help!

Logan Square is a diverse and fun neighborhood. There are tons of hip coffee shops, restaurants and bars at walking distance.

There are various busses in the area, and the blue line train is less than a 10 minute walk away.

access: Guests will have full access to the garden suite, which includes a living room area, a separate full bathroom,  and a separate bedroom. Guests will be able to access the kitchen on the main floor, which is shared with me and my wife. Guests are also welcome to enjoy the backyard.
description:
Cozy, clean and private garden suite for a pleasant stay.  The home is located on a beautiful tree-lined residential street in the Forest Glen and Jefferson Park neighborhoods of Chicago's NW side.

The garden suite has 2 options for entry. Use the front door entrance for a warm reception with my partner Laura and myself, or, if you prefer your own space, use the private back entrance. Once in the garden suite you're able to enjoy the relaxing entertainment room, or work out in the fitness area,  before arriving to your comfortable bedroom with a walk-in closet and  study / work desk in the comfort of your bedroom. The garden suite also has full access to a large private bathroom with several amenities. You can take a bath, turn on the Jacuzzi, sit down for a sauna in the shower, or just take a simple shower.

Guests will have full access to the garden suite, which includes a living room area, a separate full bathroom,  and a separate bedroom. Guests will be able to access the kitchen on the main floor, which is shared with me and my wife. Guests are also welcome to enjoy the backyard.

We are excited to welcome you into our home and ready to interact as much or as little as you would prefer! I have flexible work hours and am often working from home or out and about running errands. Either way, I am ready to respond to any requests or questions you may have. Nuestra casa es su casa - and we are happy to welcome you to it.

Forest Glen likes to call itself “Chicago’s Finest Community.” A gem of a neighborhood on Chicago’s Northwest Side, Forest Glen boasts the convenience of the city with the peacefulness of the suburbs and the neighborliness of the country. Naturally secluded and well-defined, Forest Glen contains about 550 households, almost all single-family homes.

Read more about the community here: https://www.forestglenchicago.org/

Convenient location right next to the I-94 expressway, and also close to the I-90, and minutes away from Northeastern or North Park University. Minutes from Forest Glen Metra commuter rail station and slightly farther from the Jefferson Park Blue Line CTA station.  

Street parking always available and reliable.

Nuestra casa es su casa - and we are happy to welcome you to it.

additional_house_rules:
- All guests are required to have a form of live 2-way communication during their stay (preferably US phone number)
- Door staff cannot help with questions specific to my unit (eg "Where is the lock box?") since they work for the entire building, so if you have questions or challenges, you will need to contact me directly and I'll gladly help 
- Prior to releasing check-in information, we will need confirmation that you and all of your fellow registered guests have reviewed the House Rule. 
 - No parties in apartment or common areas  - No outside guests are allowed in apartment or building without prior approval from host 
- There is a Nest security camera facing the front door to help with security and adherence to house rules. It is angled to only view the front door & is generally muted for your privacy. You can request a screenshot of the camera’s view at any time 
- Guests who violate House Rules may be asked to leave - Please be respectful of our neighbors; no loud noise between the hours of 11pm-7am 
- Unfortunately we generally can’t accommodate early check-in or late check-out  
- No smoking...of any kind  
- No emergency lock-out services guaranteed and $50 penalty applies when we are able to provide lock-out services 
- Use of amenities (eg fitness center) is at guests’ own risk 
- We require connecting with the primary guest briefly by phone before check-in to review check-in procedure & a few tips about the building. Generally only takes 5 min.

access: You are welcome to access every part of the building including the amenities floors.
description:
Enjoy premium living & the best that Chicago has to offer with this luxury penthouse floor 2 bed/2 bath apartment with floor to ceiling windows offering unbeatable lake, sunset and city views!  Everything is designed for your comfort from the beds to furnishings to the flat-screen TV & Sonos Play Bar. Plus countless  in-building amenities & central location close to top attractions like Soldier Field, Museum Campus, Art Institute. This will be one of your favorite airbnbs ever!

Use of free parking requires you to give us at least 24 hours notice that you will need it! This apartment has it all: 2 large bedrooms each outfitted with luxury memory foam mattresses, super-soft linens and an abundance of pillows. The Master suite also has a flat screen TV in case you want to watch Netflix before bed or Sport Center while you start your day!

The living room features extra high ceilings because it is the penthouse floor, a wall-mounted 55” Smart TV, Sonos Sound Bar, incredibly comfy Pottery Barn sectional...but best of off: unobstructed views of Lake Michigan and Museum Campus!

The kitchen is equipped with all of your cooking and entertaining needs: full set of dish ware & glassware, a chef’s stove and oven, baking and cooking equipment, and a Keurig for your morning Joe! 

Both bathrooms are outfitted with high end fixtures and the master suite features a walk-in shower and double vanity. 

In short: this place is so amazing that you won’t want to leave!

You are welcome to access every part of the building including the amenities floors.

We are always just a phone call away (and we promise to respond within 15 minutes) and there will always be someone local available to help you onsite within an hour.

Grant Park, Millennium Park, Shedd Aquarium, Field Museum, Soldier Field, Navy Pier, Mag Mile, Theater District, McCormick Place, Willis Tower, Watertower Place...the list goes on and on!

I would recommend using public transportation since the unit is within 5 min walk to a central subway that connects to every El Line and several bus routes. There is also indoor garage in the building for roughly $25/day (prices vary).  If requested at least 24 hrs in advance we can provide complimentary parking in our onsite garage

Please be aware that in order to take advantage of the free parking, we need to know  at LEAST 24 hrs in advance so that we can get you the parking pass. Last minute requests for parking cannot be accommodated.

additional_house_rules: Check in time 3pm-10pm.   Do not engage in any illegal activity in or around premises.  Do not disturb tenants or neighbors in or around building.  Respect quiet time from 10pm to 8am.  No guest allowed other than those specified in booking.  All guests under 21 must be accompanied by an adult.  Please notify host immediately if you notice anything that could result in danger or damage to guests or premises or if any item is not working properly.  Do use the kitchen, just ensure areas , dishes or utensils used are cleaned afterwards or put into the dishwasher.  Do not leave any food out or crumbs to ensure a sanitary and pest free environment.  Please remove wet or dirt filled shoes upon entering the premises.  Bedrooms are carpeted and we appreciate your consideration in keeping rooms clean and sanitary.  No parking on premises.  Street parking is plentiful and available.  There is a $60 fee for loss of keys.  Please lock your room and take your keys when you leave for the day.  Host will not be responsible for personal items.  Host will discuss arrangements for check out.  Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries or illnesses while on the premises and recognize they may purchase personal insurance.

description:
Drexel Suites welcomes you to the comforts of a home away from home.  Conveniently located in the culturally diverse and historic neighborhood of Hyde-Park and minutes walking distance to former President Barack Obama's mansion.  Only 10 to 15 minutes travel time to the University of Chicago campus, McCormick Place, downtown Chicago, Grant Park, Navy Pier, Lake Michigan and many historical museums.  Hyde Park offers a plethora of restaurants, shops and entertainment venues.

Drexel (garden) Suites offers four private bedrooms, two full baths and shared common areas in the living room, dining room and fully equipped kitchen. All bedrooms have locks and keys.

Upon your arrival, you will be greeted by the host or co-host to acquaint you with the space and we will be available through out the duration of your stay for any questions, concerns or friendly chats.

Beautiful Washington Park is minutes from Drexel Suites for morning jogs or strolls and during warmer months, enjoy the park's many art festivals, outdoor movies and jazz under the stars.

Bus Transportation is less than a block away and the Metra train is about 10 minutes.  Metra will take you directly inside McCormick Place Convention Center.  Street parking is plentiful and available for those who drive.

We welcome and offer special discounts for long term stays for more than 30 days.
house_rules: Check in time 3pm-10pm.   Do not engage in any illegal activity in or around premises.  Do not disturb tenants or neighbors in or around building.  Respect quiet time from 10pm to 8am.  No guest allowed other than those specified in booking.  All guests under 21 must be accompanied by an adult.  Please notify host immediately if you notice anything that could result in danger or damage to guests or premises or if any item is not working properly.  Do use the kitchen, just ensure areas , dishes or utensils used are cleaned afterwards or put into the dishwasher.  Do not leave any food out or crumbs to ensure a sanitary and pest free environment.  Please remove wet or dirt filled shoes upon entering the premises.  Bedrooms are carpeted and we appreciate your consideration in keeping rooms clean and sanitary.  No parking on premises.  Street parking is plentiful and available.  There is a $60 fee for loss of keys.  Please lock your room and take your keys when you leave for the day.  Host will not be responsible for personal items.  Host will discuss arrangements for check out.  Guests take full responsibility for any accidents, injuries or illnesses while on the premises and recognize they may purchase personal insurance.
interaction: Upon your arrival, you will be greeted by the host or co-host to acquaint you with the space and we will be available through out the duration of your stay for any questions, concerns or friendly chats.
neighborhood_overview: Beautiful Washington Park is minutes from Drexel Suites for morning jogs or strolls and during warmer months, enjoy the park's many art festivals, outdoor movies and jazz under the stars.
notes: We welcome and offer special discounts for long term stays for more than 30 days.
space: Drexel (garden) Suites offers four private bedrooms, two full baths and shared common areas in the living room, dining room and fully equipped kitchen. All bedrooms have locks and keys.
summary: Drexel Suites welcomes you to the comforts of a home away from home.  Conveniently located in the culturally diverse and historic neighborhood of Hyde-Park and minutes walking distance to former President Barack Obama's mansion.  Only 10 to 15 minutes travel time to the University of Chicago campus, McCormick Place, downtown Chicago, Grant Park, Navy Pier, Lake Michigan and many historical museums.  Hyde Park offers a plethora of restaurants, shops and entertainment venues.
transit: Bus Transportation is less than a block away and the Metra train is about 10 minutes.  Metra will take you directly inside McCormick Place Convention Center.  Street parking is plentiful and available for those who drive.

description:
Please note that photos are of a similar Domio unit in Chicago. The layout will be different, but will feature similar furniture and design.

Pair your Chicago experience with the perfect place to stay. Walking distance from some of Chicago's best areas, this gorgeous, stylish, and charming space was thoughtfully designed to capture local flair and create a relaxing environment. Whether traveling solo, with friends, or with family, see the best of art, culture, and cuisine that Chicago has to offer and have an unforgettable experience staying at this Domio.

This space exemplifies the Domio standard: uncompromising style and maximum comfort. This 2 bedroom and 2 bath home boasts an exquisite living room, luxury furniture, and premium finishes. In addition to a fully-stocked kitchen with professional grade appliances, guests will be pleased to find local decor and artwork throughout the home.

Bedroom 1:
Queen Bed

Bedroom 2:
Queen Bed

Guests have exclusive access to the apartment. Additionally, guests have access to the following building amenities:
Indoor pool 
Indoor hot tub
Fitness Center 
Seasonal outdoor deck

We do our best to tailor each experience to our guests preferences. Want advice, suggestions, or a shoulder to lean on? We are always available at your disposal. Need a place to stay but don't feel like chatting? That's okay too, we won't be offended.

Streeterville is one of Chicago's best neighborhoods and the perfect place to base your Chicago stay. This Domio is two blocks away from the spectacular John Hancock building and its famous 360 Chicago attraction and The Signature Room at the 95th. During the summer months, kick back at Oak Street Beach which is a quick stroll away. Additionally, Northwestern Memorial Hospital and Ann & Robert H Lurie Children's Hospital are less than a 10 minute walk away.

With a walkscore of 94, this Domio is conveniently located near many restaurants and attractions.
Nearest Bus Stop: Chestnut & Lake Shore Drive (157 bus) - 1 minute walk
Nearest Subway Stop: Chicago (Red Line) - 12 minute walk 
Closest Grocery Store: Potash Market - 5 minute walk

Chicago Registration: Pending

Please note that we do not allow bookings from residents of Chicago and surrounding areas.

access: Guest has full exclusive access to the suites.
description:
Newly condo in the heart of Chicago Chinatown with 3 bedrooms, 2 baths, a spacious living area and FREE private parking. This condo has 6 beds and can accommodate 9+ guests. Minutes to Downtown, McCormick Place, and popular attractions. Walking distance to public transit, stores, Starbucks, and many great restaurants.

We have other properties as well that could accommodate groups of 27+ guests or more. Please contact us for details.

Guest has full exclusive access to the suites.

We're conveniently located near the intersection of Wentworth and 18th Street. Public transportation (bus, train) are less than a block away. Major highways  (I-90/94, I-290, I-55) all converge in this area. For the foodies, this is the place to be with many great restaurants within walking distance and close by the downtown and South Loop area. Conventioneers will be glad to know that McCormick Place is a 16 minute walk/6 minutes drive away. See below for more details.


Driving distance to nearby Points of Interest:
Greektown (2.6 miles / 14 min)
Guaranteed Rate Field (1.2 miles / 5 min)
Illinois Institute of Technology (1.6 miles / 7 min)
Lincoln Park Zoo (7.8 miles / 20 min)
Little Italy (2.6 miles / 14 min)
Magnificent Mile (3.5 miles / 11 min)
McCormick Place (0.9 miles / 6 min)
Millennium Park (2.7 miles / 11 min)
Museum Campus (Aquarium, Field Museum, Adler Planetarium) - (1.8 miles / 10 min)
Navy Pier (5 miles / 15 min)
Soldier Field 2.3 miles / 7 min)
United Center (4 miles / 15 min)
University of Illinois at Chicago (2.7 miles / 11 min)
Wrigley Field (10.4 miles / 27 min)

Walking
Many of the city’s top attractions are a short walk or ride away from each other. Weather-permitting, walking is the best way to see the city and the hidden treasures of architecture and public art in the downtown area.
When planning your route, keep in mind that every 8 blocks equals 1 mile.

Chicago Public Transportation (CTA)
The buses and trains of the CTA (Chicago Transit Authority) are a fast and cost-effective way to get into and around the city. Known as the “L” (though they may be elevated or underground) the trains are a fun way to see The Loop from a new vantage point.
CTA visitor passes offer the best value, with unlimited rides on all CTA trains and buses. A 1-day pass is $10, a 3-day pass is $20, and a 7-day pass is $28.
Passes are easy to use. They activate the first time you use them and are valid for the number of consecutive days purchased. Just dip your pass into the bus fare machine or the train station turnstile.
Check the CTA website for the latest fares, travel alerts, and trip planners.

Taxis
Taxis are abundant throughout most of Chicago so finding a cab is typically easy. Taxi rates depend on gas prices and number of passengers and can get a bit pricey but provide a fast and convenient way to get around the city, particularly beyond downtown.

Biking
If time and weather permit, consider renting a bike. Chicago’s lakefront boasts 26 uninterrupted miles of easy bike and walking trails.
Half-day rentals are available from Bike and Roll at Navy Pier and Millennium Park.


From the Airports

O’Hare International Airport: 
Chicago’s O’Hare is one of the world’s busiest airports. It’s about 15 miles northwest of the Loop in downtown Chicago. O’Hare has 5 terminals, all of which have information booths and multilingual employees to assist you.

Midway International Airport:
Although it’s smaller than O’Hare, Midway is closer to the Loop and services more discount airlines (but fewer airlines overall). If you’re looking for a good deal on plane tickets, check out flights to Midway.

• Check-in time 3 PM or later. Check-out before 12 PM
• No Smoking (including e-cigarettes) in the house and common areas
• No pets
• No parties or events
• Observe quiet hours from 9:00PM to 7:00AM 
• Early check-in or late check-out can be accommodated based on occupancy and for a small fee. Please inquire if needed

additional_house_rules:
• Please be sure to close outside gates behind you so my dog Oscar doesn’t escape! 
• Please be aware that this space is my home. My own toiletries will be in the bathroom & food in the kitchen. However, I have provided a few toiletries & food items for your convenience that are clearly labeled or listed in the app. If you forgot something I didn’t provide, just ask :) 
I may have something to share or a recommendation on where you can easily find it. 
• No extra guests at the house unless you have cleared it with me at the time of booking.
• This is a safe space, free of judgement, where respectful & tolerant behavior & speech will be practiced by your host and expected from guests.
• Don’t get your apps confused. Please remember this is Airbnb, not Tinder. Advances will not be tolerated. 
• In the interest of cleanliness & bug prevention, please keep meals at the kitchen table & wash dishes upon use. 
• Due to only one bathroom being available for both of us, please let me know if you plan to get up & get ready between 7 and 930am so that we can come up with a plan. 
• Tell me the name of your favorite city so I know you’ve read these rules ;)
Thanks in advance!

access: The entire apartment is available to you, excluding the master bedroom.  This consists of a private bedroom with a water bottle to refill throughout your stay, cozy bedding, and a fresh set of towels. There is a fan & space heater (in your bedroom closet), plenty of pillows & extra blankets (both under your bed and in the living room) so that you can easily adjust your comfort. Please refrain from raising the heat above 70, but do feel free to adjust from the set temperature if needed. There is shared use of all common areas. You can watch TV in the living room. You may use the fridge & cooking essentials, drink the provided coffee, and eat the complimentary snacks! However, just like at Mom & Dad’s when you were a kid... hands out of the liquor cabinet (I can recommend great places to get your own!). The bathroom will have all the necessities - TP, cotton balls, Q-tips, and a soap/shampoo combo. Please feel free to utilize any of the outdoor spaces, seating, grill, etc.
description:
Stylish, yet welcoming sanctuary perfect for solo travelers. Private BR w/ comfy bed in charming & eclectic vintage brick building. Located in lovely Hermosa, just west of hip Logan Square.
Although a shared space, you’ll often have the whole apt to yourself. 
Hosted by a 20 yr hospitality vet, you can count on a comfortable stay w/ in-the-know Chicago info.
Cute dog sightings likely :)
**** Snuggle up & relax w/ tube time. Stay in & get work done w/ free WiFi. Go out & explore w/ pro tips! ****

The space is inside a 100 year old vintage brick Chicago style 2 flat. You’ll be in the 2nd floor apartment in a petite & cozy private bedroom including a double bed, closet, and dresser, with access to a kitchen, bathroom, living room, front porch, and backyard.
When not at work, traveling, or spending time exploring the city, your host will likely be downstairs with her mom & dog in the 1st floor apartment. 
Some ideas to get you started...
Lounge with some Netflix or listen to records in the living room. Sip on some  free coffee or read in the nook. Make dinner or get some work done on your laptop in the kitchen. Take a relaxing bath in the bathroom. Sleep, take a nap, & unwind in the bedroom. Explore the city with the help of your host - a Chicago native, hospitality veteran, dog lover, bicyclist, thrifter, yogi, and all-around art enthusiast!

The entire apartment is available to you, excluding the master bedroom.  This consists of a private bedroom with a water bottle to refill throughout your stay, cozy bedding, and a fresh set of towels. There is a fan & space heater (in your bedroom closet), plenty of pillows & extra blankets (both under your bed and in the living room) so that you can easily adjust your comfort. Please refrain from raising the heat above 70, but do feel free to adjust from the set temperature if needed. There is shared use of all common areas. You can watch TV in the living room. You may use the fridge & cooking essentials, drink the provided coffee, and eat the complimentary snacks! However, just like at Mom & Dad’s when you were a kid... hands out of the liquor cabinet (I can recommend great places to get your own!). The bathroom will have all the necessities - TP, cotton balls, Q-tips, and a soap/shampoo combo. Please feel free to utilize any of the outdoor spaces, seating, grill, etc.

I can always be reached through the Airbnb app, but if it’s more convenient, also by text, phone call, or email. My mom lives in the apartment downstairs & will also be there to help with any issues that may arise if I’m not immediately available. I’ll give you your space, but know that still means I’m dying to give you recommendations so that you can have the best possible time while you’re visiting this great city!

Hermosa is a small, quiet, and family-oriented neighborhood, rich with culture, pride, and history. 
Experience great neighborhood restaurants: tacos at L’Patron, pozole at Pozoleria San Juan, ice cream at La Michoacana, tamales at Chilo Y Chela, donuts at Somethin’ Sweet, and much more! Take a tour of local cidery Right Bee Cider or grab a cocktail at WeeGee’s. Go for a nice walk, run, or bike ride to Kelvyn Park or take the 606 Bloomingdale Trail. Check out the Klairmont Kollections antique car museum. Go creep on Walt Disney’s birthplace. Once you’re through, hop on a bus or grab a car to soak up nearby Logan Square & all of its nightlife, shopping, farmer’s markets, restaurants, theatres, and vibrant scene. 
Bus stops, laundromat, currency exchange, grocery store all within walking distance.

Street parking is free on Kilbourn, Armitage, and surrounding streets, but please watch out for signs. Garage space may be available, so please let me know if it’s needed! Close to Armitage, Fullerton, North, Grand buses heading east & west; Cicero, Pulaski buses heading north & south. If you need a Ventra pass for public transportation, they can be purchased at the currency exchange on Armitage, at Kostner (open 24 hours!). Less than a mile to Bloomingdale Trail Bike/Walk/Run path. Call a taxi ahead or use your Uber or Lyft app to hail a car minutes away!

I have a dog who lives upstairs, so severe allergy sufferers beware. For the most part, he will only be home when I am and he doesn’t spend any time in the guest bedroom. He is excessively sweet, but might jump because he’s just so excited to see you!
house_rules:
• Please be sure to close outside gates behind you so my dog Oscar doesn’t escape! 
• Please be aware that this space is my home. My own toiletries will be in the bathroom & food in the kitchen. However, I have provided a few toiletries & food items for your convenience that are clearly labeled or listed in the app. If you forgot something I didn’t provide, just ask :) 
I may have something to share or a recommendation on where you can easily find it. 
• No extra guests at the house unless you have cleared it with me at the time of booking.
• This is a safe space, free of judgement, where respectful & tolerant behavior & speech will be practiced by your host and expected from guests.
• Don’t get your apps confused. Please remember this is Airbnb, not Tinder. Advances will not be tolerated. 
• In the interest of cleanliness & bug prevention, please keep meals at the kitchen table & wash dishes upon use. 
• Due to only one bathroom being available for both of us, please let me know if you plan to get up & get ready between 7 and 930am so that we can come up with a plan. 
• Tell me the name of your favorite city so I know you’ve read these rules ;)
Thanks in advance!

My mom lives in the apartment downstairs & will also be there to help with any issues that may arise if I’m not immediately available. I’ll give you your space, but know that still means I’m dying to give you recommendations so that you can have the best possible time while you’re visiting this great city!

description:
This newly remodeled 3-bedroom unit with 1-bath apartment is perfect for both leisure & business travelers. Located on a safe, tree-lined street, in the Lakeview neighborhood, with a completely private entrance of it's own.  

We are just a 5 minute walk away from the CTA Irving Park Brown Line, which will get you downtown in less than 20min. We are also conveniently close to Wrigley Field, Lake Michigan, Bus Stops, and other great neighborhood shops, restaurants, and nightlife.

- Newly remodeled space with modern furniture that is equally relaxing and comfortable.
- The entire unit is for your own use. The 50" Flat Screen TV in the living room has Cable TV and Netflix.
- Fully furnished kitchen, Basic Dinnerware, Cutlery, Drinking Glasses, as well as Pots & Pans provided. 
- We provide complimentary snacks, tea, coffee, & water bottles.
- We have a washer and dryer in the basement. You may use it at your convenience. Detergent & dryer sheets provided!

- We can be available as little or as much as you like.

- Number of great coffee places, restaurants and nightlife in the area, feel free to ask for recommendations! 
- 20 minute walk to Wrigley field, closest free parking
- Short walk to Welles Park & Lincoln Square

- Free and available street parking 
- 5-minute walk from Irving Brown Line 
- 3-minute walk to Irving and Ashland Bus
-Short ride to Lake Shore Drive

*Guest policy*
When booking, please make sure you put the accurate number of guests in your  reservation as this will affect the price. Prices based off number of guests and nights. No guests will be allowed who are not on the reservation.
house_rules:
- Quiet Hours 1am-7am
- No shoes in the house
- Wash dishes after use
-Note Guest policy in the description

description:
3 Bed, 3 Bath Single Family Home in Lincoln Park on a quiet, tree-lined street.

Single-family home in Lincoln Park area of Chicago. We are close to many bars, restaurants, parks and everything the city has to offer. If you need to head downtown it's a short 10 minute drive (depending on traffic) or Uber/Lift trip.

You'll have full-access to our home including a spacious front porch to "hang" with the neighborhood or a back porch for privacy.  Parking on the street is safe and usually easy to find spots to park.

Our street is quiet with friendly neighbors and speed bumps to prevent speedy drivers.

description:
Private entrance In-law suite with full bathroom, kitchenette, bedroom with queen bed, living room with sleeper sofa, bathroom with tub/shower. Access to washer/dryer and back yard. 1 mile from Wrigley Field (20 min walk), steps from Southport Corridor with restaurants, bars, and shopping. 2 - 4 blocks to trains  which will take you downtown. 1/2 block from Belmont bus which will take you to the lake (10 min ride). We live onsite so we are available for questions, directions, etc.

1 block from Whole Foods, a 5 minute walk to Core Power Yoga and Orange Theory Fitness. Schuba's on the corner has live music regularly. Southport Lanes, 2 blocks away has bowling and billiards.

We are 2 blocks from the "L" Brown Line at the Southport stop and 4 blocks form the Red Line at the at the Belmont stop. We are 1/2 block from the Belmont bus which will take you to the lake in about 10 mins in light traffic.

There is free street parking on our street. The street to east is free parking as well.  The street to the west is metered and there is a metered lot there as well.

additional_house_rules:
WiFi use is limited to regular internet use such as checking email and searching on the internet. Our WiFi does not support video streaming, face-time, Skype or anything else that uses a lot of data. Please use your own data source for those types of operations. 
Please use headphones when using technology as a courtesy to other guests and to your hosts. 
Make sure you leave the doggie gates closed at all times as our little pup is an escape artist! Be sure to greet the dogs warmly when you arrive and they will love you back. (and stop barking as soon as they realize you are friendly!)
No smoking please!

access: Bedrooms, private bathroom, kitchen, living room, wifi, TV room in basement, backyard, front porch, dining room, bicycles.
description:
Great home in fantastic location in Historic District of Oak Park. Super comfy queen bed in large bedroom, full bed in the other room. Private bathroom for guests right off the bedrooms. Must love dogs! Two super friendly energetic pups!

Just two blocks from the Frank Lloyd Wright Home and Studio and a dozen other Frank Lloyd Wright historic homes, this beautiful, historic four square house in world famous Oak Park is a great location for architecture fans or anyone visiting Chicago for business or pleasure. It is a short walk to the train to downtown Chicago, McCormick Place, Wrigley Field, The Untied Center, Cellular One and Soldier Field. 

And as for the house itself: You will be very comfortable in a Queen size bed with your own private bathroom. We have a second room available with a double bed if you need more space. The second room shares a bathroom with you and we do not rent it out to other parties while you stay with us. If you need the second room you will need to request us to book you a "Special offer" on the website. You may also use the family room with large screen TV and surround sound, front porch with swing and table and chairs. Free wi-fi and a continental breakfast are included. Our home is in a quiet, safe, friendly family neighborhood. You can walk to restaurants, shopping, movies, parks and buses and trains to downtown Chicago. 

One more thing! You must like dogs - we have two very friendly pups!

Bedrooms, private bathroom, kitchen, living room, wifi, TV room in basement, backyard, front porch, dining room, bicycles.

We are not intrusive, sometimes we are not even home. Guests have lots of privacy and house to themselves most of the time. John works in his home office during the day but is separate from the rest of the house. 

Beautiful tree lined streets with hundred year old homes that are all unique, interesting, historic and different. Very safe to walk around all times of the day and night. Very clean. Very friendly neighbors. 

Buses and trains are within a few blocks walking distance or short bicycle ride. We loan bikes out to guests to ride to the train which is only one mile away. A beautiful short walk past many historic Frank Lloyd Wright homes. 

We do have a coffee maker and some cereal and food in the refrigerator, but we do not make breakfast and sometimes if we are not home we cannot guarantee that we will have breakfast foods available, although we will try our best! 
We have an extra bedroom available for an extra fee for friends or family members as it shares the bathroom with your room. Please ask about it if you have an additional guest.

Make sure you leave the doggie gates closed at all times as our little pup is an escape artist! Be sure to greet the dogs warmly when you arrive and they will love you back. (and stop barking as soon as they realize you are friendly!)
No smoking please!

access: Guests can enter through the main house, or a private entrees leading straight to the apartment. Guests are also welcome to cook a meal in the shared main kitchen.
description: Step through the door to reveal a whole mini apartment of modern and vintage charm, complete with office, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. Lots of original art work to inspire you. Pick a volume from the well-stocked shelves to enjoy out on the deck.
house_rules: Please remove shoes before entering house.
interaction: Guests are allowed space and privacy, although if they have questions we are always available by phone.
neighborhood_overview: Located near the charming Swedish neighborhood of Andersonville, there's a wide variety of restaurants, shops, and galleries locally. For a delicious lunch, head for Sauce and Bread. Loyola train stop is a short walk or even shorter bus ride away.
notes:
You will meet happy happy go lucky Zoe, Portuguese Water Dog.  She is a hypoallergenic and non shedding small pup. 

Zoe won’t go into your space unless you invite her in and leave door open into your apartment.
space:
This apartment is unique because it is listed under private room, although it has all of the aspects of a private apartment. 

You have a door that locks entering into your own private space with multiple rooms , consisting of a private living room, office, bathroom, and large bedroom with luxurious queen bed.  

Please enjoy a cup of morning coffee, afternoon book or evening glass of wine on our beautiful outside deck.   Deck overlooks beautifully  landscaped  luscious back yard. 

Main shared kitchen and outside grill is also available if you’d like to cook a meal.
summary: Step through the door to reveal a whole mini apartment of modern and vintage charm, complete with office, living room, bedroom, and bathroom. Lots of original art work to inspire you. Pick a volume from the well-stocked shelves to enjoy out on the deck.
transit: If the guest does not have access to a personal vehicle, the train station is the easiest and cheapest way to get around.

access: We will all share the full kitchen and living area with TV and dining table along with the full bathroom. Your private room is your private space as all other areas will be shared between you, myself and my roommate.
description:
Our apartment is located on the West Side within a 5 minute drive of the West Loop (a hub of unique Chicago restaurants and shops). We are also in the middle of a dead end street which means there is no through traffic and is often very quiet compared to downtown and other areas. Both my roommate and I utilize the free street parking and have never had a problem finding a spot. We are also within walking distance of the Blue Line and Green Line and about a 20 minute train ride to Downtown.

quiet 3 bedroom apartment on the first floor of an apartment building. Fully furnished and equipped with all the basics (tv, fridge, stove etc.) tastefully decorated so you will feel at home. shared bathroom, kitchen and living space. private bedroom with three twin sized beds (no longer air mattresses, actual beds), and full closet.

We will all share the full kitchen and living area with TV and dining table along with the full bathroom. Your private room is your private space as all other areas will be shared between you, myself and my roommate.

My roommate and I are both 24yr old females who have been living in the city for a couple years now. I am in graduate school and my roommate works full time as a dog walker. We are both pretty quiet and enjoy our apartment because it is a place to come home to after a long day and relax.

There is free street parking up and down our block. We are also 3 city blocks from the Blue Line (subway train) at the kedzie/homan stop.

- We have 3 single beds. The room is big enough for 5 but please make note of the amount of beds as you might need to share.

PARKING: there is free street parking up and down the block our apartment is on. Both my roommate and I park there as well.

- EARLY CHECK IN: allowed only if it is to drop off luggage and is communicated with host beforehand. You may come to drop off your luggage at anytime on the day of your check in. You will not have access to the room until actual check in time. Cost to check in early to drop off luggage is $10 per person. 

- LATE CHECK OUT: allowed only if it is to keep luggage and communicated with the host beforehand. The room itself must be vacated and the luggage packed and left in the hallway. You may come back to pick up the luggage whenever you’d like on the day of your checkout. Cost to keep luggage after check out is $10 per person.

Heated bathroom floors and multiple Smart TVs add high-end touches to this charming and luxurious brick-and-timber loft. Drink in great city views from the balcony. Please Note, the 2nd bedroom has a futon bed.

interaction: If guests are arriving on a weekend, I will meet guests the first day to show them how to get in, etc. and to give them the keys. If you are arriving during the week, I will provide access via a lockbox and I can be available to meet later in the evening if need be. I am available via text and phone if there are any issues or if you have any questions.
neighborhood_overview: Located in buzzing Chinatown with access to the entire city. Bridgeport, the South Loop, UIC, little Italy, and various museums are all within convenient reach.  The 24-hour Red Line train runs just four blocks east for easy trips to the city.
notes: We live in a quiet building so please be very respectful of neighbors, etc.
space:
Newly Renovated
Brand new bathrooms with heated floors
Fireplace
2 smart tvs- one in bedroom and one in Living room. We do not have cable, but you can use netflix, amazon, etc. HDMI cable behind couch that you can plug your own device into.
Full kitchen with granite countertops and stainless steel appliances.
summary: Lounge on an incredibly plush sectional sofa in front of an inviting fireplace. Heated bathroom floors and multiple Smart TVs add high-end touches to this charming and luxurious brick-and-timber loft. Drink in great city views from the balcony. Please Note, the 2nd bedroom has a futon bed.

CTA bus right at corner
Red Line (Cermak) 4 blocks away
Divvy bike station 2 blocks away
Uber

access: Guests have full access to the apartment living room, the bathroom and kitchen. The kitchen is fully furnished with all new appliances (range, refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher) pots, pans, dishes, eating utensils, rice cooker and electric kettle.
description:
A private bedroom in a two bedroom apartment located in Chicago's Marshall Square/Pilsen/Douglas Park neighborhood.

The apartment was completely renovated during the past year and is located on the third floor of a three story century old vintage brick building, locally known as a three flat. Redone in the style of a "soft loft" the unit has 10 foot ceilings, spiral duct work, newly refinished hardwood maple floors and an exposed brick wall in the kitchen. This bedroom is one of two in the apartment and has a full size bed and  a large walk in closet. The apartment is shared- at a maximum - with one other person. Each guest has their own bedroom. Each bedroom door has a keyed lock. The bedrooms are on opposite sides of the apartment.

Guests have full access to the apartment living room, the bathroom and kitchen. The kitchen is fully furnished with all new appliances (range, refrigerator, microwave and dishwasher) pots, pans, dishes, eating utensils, rice cooker and electric kettle.

I am always available, either at the building or can be reached by text, email or phone.

Marshall Square, adjacent to the better known Pilsen area, was settled and built largely by Czechs in the later part of the 19th  and early 20th century. Buildings are almost exclusively brick with attractive facades and are separated by narrow "gangways". While not one of Chicago's trendier areas, transportation links into the Loop are excellent, with a train station at the end of the block and less than a 20 minute ride to the Loop. The neighborhood is predominately Mexican now, with many excellent and inexpensive restaurants. Laguinitas Brewery and Pub is just a few blocks away as is Cinespace Movie Studio, where several network and cable tv shows are filmed.

The apartment is located less than a block from the California Pink Line elevated stop which is less than 20 minutes from the Loop. There are two grocery stores, a Walmart, a Planet Fitness, and many restaurants within a short walking distance from the building.

For medical students completing a clinical rotation: St. Anthony's Hospital is around the corner, Mt. Sinai Hospital is six blocks away, and the Illinois Medical District (Rush, University of Illinois, Stroger and Jesse Brown Hospitals) are just 4 stops away (8 minutes)   on the Pink line El .

A quiet, respectful, professional environment must be maintained at all times. No overnight guests are allowed. Absolutely no smoking or partying.

description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cozy River North furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and cheery living room with great  views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Chicago has to offer! (#CHI127)

Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your charming living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this River North apartment has to offer.  This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:
  
- Doorman
- 24/7 Security
- Pet Friendly
- Dog Park/Run
- Rooftop Pool
- Gym
- Indoor Parking
- Roof Deck
- Garden

- Elevator

The entire apartment is yours to enjoy! You’ll either be personally greeted by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions.

Throughout your stay, you’ll have access to our Client Experience team through the Blueground App. You can schedule additional cleanings, submit maintenance requests, and view our neighborhood recommendations with just a few taps.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

This furnished apartment is located in River North, Chicago’s most trendy neighborhood. The bridges combined with the riverwalk offer incredible views. Nearby on Michigan Avenue is the city’s premier shopping area. One of the neighborhood’s biggest assets is the walk-to-work appeal. Young professionals, who live and work in the area, can quickly get to the office in the morning and just as easily enjoy an after-work drink, as the area is considered a premier entertainment center. Don’t miss a stroll on Kinzie and Hubbard streets. Merchandise Mart, the iconic building with showrooms, shops, and office space, is only a 5 minute walk. The Loop is just across the bridge and is about 5 minute walk.

This Blueground apartment can be booked for a minimum of one month, to a year or more.
house_rules:
- A passport or ID number and an address have to be provided upon confirming the booking as per building regulations. In case a guest does not provide the above, the check in will be cancelled
- Our Pet Policy outlines the weight limit and breed restrictions, along with related fees. Guests should notify us of any pets prior to check-in (failing to do so will incur a penalty)
- Parking is offered based on availability and is subject to a fee.
- All occupants that plan to reside in the apartment may be subject to both a criminal and background check at any time. Participation is necessary to rent a property.
- Blueground has the right to enter and inspect the apartment or to show the apartment to a potential tenant any day of the week between 9am and 6pm as long as the tenant has been informed via email at least one day in advance
- Please contact us for details

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.
